text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: may they continue to praise You, Selah.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Fortunate is the people whose lot is thus;
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: for whom Adonoy is their God.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: I will exalt You, my God, the King,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and bless Your Name forever and ever.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Every day I will bless You
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and extol Your Name forever and ever.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Adonoy is great and highly extolled,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The splendor of Your glorious majesty,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: and the words of Your wonders I will speak.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Of Your awesome might, they will speak
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and Your greatness I will recount.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: They will make mention of Your bountifulness,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: and joyfully exult in Your righteousness.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: slow to anger and great in kindliness.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: His mercy encompasses all His works.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: All Your works will thank You, Adonoy,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and Your pious ones will bless You.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Of the honor of Your kingship they will speak,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: and Your might they will declare.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: To reveal to men His mighty acts,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: and the glorious splendor of His kingship.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Your kingship is the kingship for all times,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: and Your dominion is in every generation.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: The eyes of all look expectantly to You,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: their food at its proper time.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: and satisfy the desire of every living being.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Adonoy is just in all His ways
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: and benevolent in all His deeds.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: The will of those who fear Him He fulfills;
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: He hears their cry and delivers them.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: Adonoy watches over all those who love Him,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: and will destroy all the wicked.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Praise of Adonoy my mouth will declare,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: His holy Name forever and ever.
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: in the world which He created
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: and may He rule His kingdom
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: and in the lifetime of the entire House of Israel,
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.0_First Day, 0_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: And how can we justify ourselves?

text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: for Your right hand is extended
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Not with virtue nor with good deeds
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: but like the poor and needy
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: At Your door, do we knock,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Please do not turn us away empty-handed
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: unto You does all flesh come.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: to prostrate themselves before You, Adonoy.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: They will come and prostrate themselves
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and they will give honor to Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Come let us prostrate ourselves and bow;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let us kneel before Adonoy, our Maker.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: give thanks to Him, bless His Name.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: As for us, through Your abundant kindness
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: toward Your Holy Sanctuary in awe of You.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: who stand in the House of Adonoy

text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Let us come to His Dwelling Places,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: let us prostrate ourselves at His footstool.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His footstool,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His holy mountain,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: for Adonoy our God is holy.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: tremble before Him all [peoples of] the earth.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: and give thanks to Your Name
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: for Your kindness and for Your truth;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Your word far beyond Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: who is like You, a mighty God;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and Your faithfulness is round about You.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: who can be likened to Adonoy
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: among the sons of the mighty?
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and until the skies is Your truth.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: For great is Adonoy and most highly extolled,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: and awesome is He above all gods.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: For a great Almighty is Adonoy
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: and a great King over all gods.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: For who is so mighty in heaven or on earth
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Who would not fear You, King of nations?
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: For to You it is fitting;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: for among all the wise ones of the nations,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: There is none like You, Adonoy
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 89_Paragraph: and great is Your Name in might.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: Yours is an arm with might
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: Yours is the day, also Yours is the night,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: For in His hands are the depths of the earth,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: and the heights of the mountains are His.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: Who can recount the mighty deeds of Adonoy,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: or cause to be heard all His praise?
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: is the greatness, the might, the glory,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: for all that is in heaven and on earth [is Yours];
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: the inhabited world and its fullness;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: You shattered the heads of sea monsters
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: when it raises its waves, You still them.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 120_Paragraph: in the city of our God,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts, God of Israel,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: in the great council of the holy ones
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 128_Paragraph: over all that are about Him.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 140_Paragraph: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: let us walk with the throngs.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: is the soul of every living thing,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 150_Paragraph: and the body is Your doing,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 158_Paragraph: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.0_First Day, 1_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: This prayer was composed by Benjamin ben Zarach

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: can we pour out our words of prayer?

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: who tear at us like painful thorns;

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: They rise against You saying with scorn:

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: See the humiliation of those who groan,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: they rely on You, and to You they cleave.

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: and for Your pardon, we hope,

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: Who loves righteousness from of old,

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: Slow to anger, Abounding in kindness,

text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 123_Paragraph: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 127_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 128_Paragraph: The pious have disappeared from the earth,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: and uprightness in man no longer exists.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 130_Paragraph: No one calls with Your Name in righteousness,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 131_Paragraph: inspired to be steadfast with You.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: for the devoted man has ceased,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: from among the sons of man.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: For with You is the source of life,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: in Your light shall we see light.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: For with Adonoy there is loving-kindness,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: and with Him there is much redemption.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 142_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 146_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 149_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 151_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 153_Paragraph: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 156_Paragraph: and as You forgave this people
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 163_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 164_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 165_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 166_Paragraph: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 167_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 169_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.0_First Day, 2_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: over Your city and over Your people.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: This prayer was composed by Shlomo ben Yehuda, HaBavli
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: There is none that offers righteous prayer,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: the best of men is like a briar-thorn;
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: to seek compassion on those who are crushed—
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: The blameless and pure man has vanished,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and the righteous has been trampled;
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: thus a generation impoverished in good deeds
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: is held to account for its iniquities,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: for there is none to direct its ways.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: [even against the righteous] who offered, as members of Your household
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: to pray and intercede for us;
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: and thus, who is there, great or small,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: that is able to offer confession and prayer
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: to the Holy One Who is ever awake?
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: to offer prayer on behalf of the congregation
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: to Him Who searches and probes [hearts;]
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: deficient in virtue and full of sin,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: how can I find favor with my supplication?
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: You are good to those who call upon You
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: You bear their burden and sustain them;
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: expand Your precious kindness upon me,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: and give ear to my voice with Your love.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: [Regard me] as one who is of worthy character
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: as one who is mature and fluent
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: consider my broken heart before You,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: and let me not be ashamed;
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: for the sake of my relief,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: but all is revealed to You
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Who has formed us from clay,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: We are left like a single tree on a mountain
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: our glory has turned to rubbish and refuse,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: answer us and sustain us in our servitude,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: by seeking out those who are lost from us.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: Those who are inflicted with pain
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: by the rods of Your chastisement,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: [God,] Whose powerful voice hews flames of fire,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: Who decrees both good and its opposite,

text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: their multitude—from the wrath of judgement
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: they beseech You in quiet prayer,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: is glorified by Your desire to grant life,

text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: look to us, and answer us,

text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 93_Paragraph: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,

text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: and as You forgave this people
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 151_Paragraph: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 153_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 156_Paragraph: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 158_Paragraph: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 159_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.0_First Day, 3_Chapter, 163_Paragraph: over Your city and over Your people.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: This prayer was composed by Shlomo ben Yehudah HaBavli
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God, and God of our Fathers!
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: May our fervent prayers come before You,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: may Your ear be attentive to our supplication,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: for You look at our righteous deeds,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and overlook the complaints against us.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: We are disgraced, ashamed to raise our heads,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: for the sweet aroma of our good name
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: and the Written and Oral Torah,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: we therefore hide our faces in the ground.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Distress and anguish seize us from all sides,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: we are like sheep adrift without shelter,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: if we turn to the right,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: to the left, there is dread
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: lest we fall prey to those who hunt us.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: May Your ever-seeing eyes be opened
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: to behold our affliction and distress
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: may our mourning be turned into exultation,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: we, our kings and our priests to disgrace;
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: from glorious heights and [Your] mighty love,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: we have been hurled to the earth
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: We did not seek Your Presence—
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: nor did we seek understanding of Your truth,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: because of the stench of our iniquity;
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: we were destined for the same end as Sodom,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: for we diminished the sound of Torah,4Literally “mill”. The study of Torah is likened to the grinding of a mill which operates day and night.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: we were almost destroyed, but for Your grace.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: You spared the remnant [of the First Temple,]
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: You established and fenced in [the Second,]
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: we were cast away because of the sin5This refers to שִנֽאַת חִנָם, unwarranted hatred, which was the cause for the destruction of the Second Temple.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: which equals the three sins6The three sins of idolatry, adultery, and murder were the cause for the destruction of the First Temple. which You despise;
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: You trampled because of us (our sins).
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have acted corruptly and treacherously,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: thus we were driven from one yoke to another;7From exile to exile.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: remember Your promise never to abhor us,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: gather Your scattered ones and rule over them.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: After all that has befallen us,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: we know that Your judgements are righteous,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: and we alone caused our disgrace,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: for even to this day we have not changed,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: and we appear before You with great guilt.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: exile and captivity tested and refined them;
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: Through Your mercy, shown many times,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: may we find deliverance in You—
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: fulfill Your promise of “I will deliver them;”8Hosea 1:7.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: let them come from afar in droves,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: and some in ships from Kittim.9See Numbers 24:24.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 70_Paragraph: They are Yours, Your servants and Your people,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 71_Paragraph: cherish them as in the days of old—
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: draw us that we may follow You;
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: put us among those inscribed in Your Book,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: for we all yearn to fear Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: May this small people increase a thousandfold,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: grow into a mighty nation in our borders;
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: with all Your ways of righteousness,
text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: turn back from Your fierce anger

text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: He removes their sins one by one,

text.0_First Day, 4_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Remember not the sins of our ancestors;
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: let Your compassion come swiftly toward us,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: for we have been brought very low.
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: The sins of our youth and our transgressions,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy.
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: for they are from the beginning of the world.
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: which You have acquired of old,

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: the love of Zion, forget not until eternity.

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: for it is time to be gracious to her,

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: do not regard the stubborness of this people,

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: and also my covenant with Abraham
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: and the land I will remember.
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: Remember to us the covenant of the ancestors,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: “And I will remember for their sake,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: in the sight of the nations;
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: Do unto us as You promised,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: when they are in the land of their enemies,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: and I will not abhor them, to destroy them,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: to annul My covenant with them;
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: for I am Adonoy, their God.”
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: Be accessible to us when we seek You,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: you will seek Adonoy, your God,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah:
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: “And Adonoy, your God will open your heart,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: and the heart of your descendants,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: and cleanse us, as it is written:
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Blot out our transgressions for Your sake,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 105_Paragraph: and your sins, I will not recall.”
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: Make our sins as white as snow or wool,
text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: though your sins be as scarlet,

text.0_First Day, 6_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: though they be red as crimson,

text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.

text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;

text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: But indeed we and our fathers have sinned:
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 140_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 142_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 146_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 150_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 151_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 153_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 163_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 166_Paragraph: We have acted wickedly and have transgressed;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 167_Paragraph: we have therefore not been delivered.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: Grant that our hearts [be inspired to]
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 171_Paragraph: as is written by the hand of Your prophet,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 172_Paragraph: “Let the wicked man abandon his ways,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: and the man of iniquity his thoughts;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 174_Paragraph: and let him return unto Adonoy,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 175_Paragraph: and He will have compassion on him,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 184_Paragraph: and purify us from all our defilement.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 187_Paragraph: as it is written by the hand of Your prophet,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 188_Paragraph: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 193_Paragraph: Micah, Your servant, said before You,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 195_Paragraph: Who bears iniquity and overlooks transgression
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 196_Paragraph: of the remnant of His inheritance;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 197_Paragraph: Who does not retain His anger forever,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 199_Paragraph: He will again have compassion on us,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 201_Paragraph: and cast into the depths of the sea,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 203_Paragraph: And all the sins of Your people
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 205_Paragraph: You will cast into a place
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 206_Paragraph: where they will never be remembered
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 209_Paragraph: You will grant truth to Jacob,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 211_Paragraph: as You have sworn to our fathers
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 215_Paragraph: “Incline Your ear, my God and hear;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 216_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 217_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 218_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 221_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 222_Paragraph: My Master, hear! my Master, forgive!
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 223_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 227_Paragraph: over Your city and Your people.”
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 228_Paragraph: Ezra, the Scribe, said before You,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 229_Paragraph: “My God, I am [so] ashamed, and disgraced,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 230_Paragraph: that I cannot lift my face to You, my God,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 231_Paragraph: for our iniquities have risen over our heads,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 232_Paragraph: and our guilt has grown to the heavens.”
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 233_Paragraph: “And You are a God of pardon,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 236_Paragraph: and [therefore] You did not forsake them.”
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 237_Paragraph: Do not forsake us, our Father,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 238_Paragraph: do not cast us off, our Creator,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 239_Paragraph: do not abandon us, our Maker,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 242_Paragraph: Fulfill for us, Adonoy, our God,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 244_Paragraph: by the hand of Jeremiah, Your seer
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 246_Paragraph: “In those days and at that time,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 248_Paragraph: the iniquity of Israel will be sought,
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 250_Paragraph: and the sins of Judah [will be sought]
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 251_Paragraph: but they shall not be found;
text.0_First Day, 7_Chapter, 253_Paragraph: those whom I leave as a remnant.”
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Upon us is Your Name called,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Adonoy! act [now] for the sake of Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your truth.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your covenant.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your greatness and glory.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your Law.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your glorious majesty.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your congregation.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your memorial.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your kindliness.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your goodness.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your Unity.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your honor.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your teaching.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your kingship.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your eternity.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your counsel.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your strength.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your magnificence.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your righteousness.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your holiness.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your abundant mercy.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your Divine Presence.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your praise.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Your beloved ones,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Abraham, Isaac,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Moses and Aaron.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: Act for the sake of David and Solomon.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Jerusalem,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Act for the sake of Zion,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: Act for the sake of the desolation
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: Act for the sake of the destruction
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: Act for the sake of the blood
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: of Your servants that was spilled.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: Act for the sake of those who were slain
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: Act for the sake of those who were slaughtered
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: Act for the sake of those
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: who went through fire and water
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Act for the sake of nursing-infants
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: Act for the sake of weaned-children
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: Act for Your sake and not ours.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Act for Your sake and deliver us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: Answer us, our God, answer us!
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Answer us, our Father, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: Answer us, our Creator, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: Answer us, our Redeemer, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: Answer us, our Seeker, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: Answer us, faithful Almighty, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: Answer us, steadfast and benevolent One,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: Answer us, pure and upright One, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: Answer us, living and permanent One,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: Answer us, good and beneficent One,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 71_Paragraph: Answer us, Knower of our inclination,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: Answer us, Suppressor of Anger, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: Answer us, One enrobed in righteousness,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: Answer us, Supreme King of kings, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: Answer us, awesome and exalted One,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: Answer us, Pardoner and Forgiver, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: Answer us, You Who answer in time of distress,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Answer us, Redeemer and Saver, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: Answer us, just and upright One, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: He Who is near to those who call upon Him,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: Answer us, merciful and gracious One,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 89_Paragraph: Answer us, You Who listen to the needy,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: Answer us, Supporter of the innocent,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 93_Paragraph: Answer us, God of our fathers, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: Answer us, God of Abraham, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: Answer us, Fear of Isaac, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: Answer us, Mighty One of Jacob, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: Answer us, Helper of the Tribes, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 98_Paragraph: Answer us, Stronghold of the Matriarchs,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Answer us, Whom it is hard to provoke,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 102_Paragraph: Answer us, You Who are easily reconciled,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 104_Paragraph: Answer us, You Who answer at a favorable time,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: Answer us, Father of orphans, answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: He Who answered our father Abraham
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: on Mount Moriah, He will answer us.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: He Who answered Isaac, his son,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: when he was bound on the altar,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: He Who answered Jacob in Beth El,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: He Who answered our ancestors at
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: He Who answered Moses at Horeb,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 124_Paragraph: He Who answered Aaron with the incense pan,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 127_Paragraph: when he rose from among the congregation,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: He Who answered Joshua at Gilgal,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 131_Paragraph: He Who answered Samuel at Mizpah,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 134_Paragraph: and Solomon, his son, in Jerusalem,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: He Who answered Elijah on Mount Carmel,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: He Who answered Elisha in Jericho,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: in the belly of the whale,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: King of Judah, in his illness,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: in the midst of the fiery furnace,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 153_Paragraph: He Who answered Mordecai and Esther
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: in Shushan, the capital [city of Persia],
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 156_Paragraph: He Who answered Ezra in captivity,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: May the Merciful One, Who answers the poor,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: Who answers the broken in spirit,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 172_Paragraph: Merciful One, redeem, Merciful One, save,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: Merciful One, have compassion on us,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 175_Paragraph: And David said to Gad (II Samuel 24:14),
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 177_Paragraph: let us fall into the hand of Adonoy
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 179_Paragraph: but into the hand of man let me not fall.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 185_Paragraph: Adonoy, do not rebuke me with Your anger,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 186_Paragraph: nor chastise me with Your rage.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 189_Paragraph: help me Adonoy, for my bones are terrified.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 190_Paragraph: My soul, too, is utterly terrified,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 193_Paragraph: deliver me for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 194_Paragraph: For in death there is no mention of You;
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 195_Paragraph: in the lower world who will thank You.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 196_Paragraph: I am worn out with my sighing,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 197_Paragraph: every night I cause my bed to float;
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 198_Paragraph: with my tears, I melt my couch.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 199_Paragraph: My eye is dimmed from anger,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 200_Paragraph: it has aged because of my tormentors.
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 201_Paragraph: Depart from me, all you evildoers,
text.0_First Day, 8_Chapter, 202_Paragraph: for Adonoy has heard the voice of my weeping.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: (The following prayer is said only if a Minyan of ten males is present.)
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: He wounds and heals, He slays and revives,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: He raises up from the pit to life eternal.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: When a son sins, his father smites him,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: A rebellious slave is put in chains,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: but if the master desires, he breaks the chains.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: and we have sinned against You—
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: —our souls are filled with bitter affliction.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: We beseech You, in Your abundant mercy,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: so that we are not completely annihilated
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Angels of mercy!11Some authorities omit this prayer because they object to the idea of praying to angels.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: before the Presence of the Lord of mercy.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Cause our prayers to be heard
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Cause our cries to be heard
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: before Him Who listens to cries.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: bring our tears before the King
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: Mention before Him, cause Him to hear
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: of the Torah learning and good deeds
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: of our ancestors who repose in the dust.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: and give life to their descendants
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: so that the remnant of Jacob will not perish;
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: for the flock of the faithful shepherd
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: an example and a byword [of humiliation].
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: Hasten and answer us, God of our deliverance,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: and redeem us from all harsh decrees,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: Your righteous annointed and Your people.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Master in heaven, we beseech You,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: as a captive implores his captor.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: Grant our petition and our request,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: Master in heaven, we beseech You,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: as a slave implores his master.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: We are oppressed and live in darkness,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: We don’t have the strength to appease You,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: Master, do it for the sake of the covenant,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: which You made with our forefathers.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 71_Paragraph: guard the remnant of the unique people
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and let not the unique nation perish,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: who proclaim the Oneness of Your Name,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [saying:] Adonoy is our God, Adonoy is One.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: guard the remnant of the holy people
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: and let not the holy nation perish
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: You Who are appeased by pleas for mercy,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: for there is none else to help.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: be gracious to us and answer us
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: deal with us charitably and kindly
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: As for us, we know not what to do;
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: but our eyes are upon You.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: for they are from the beginning of the world.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: Adonoy! may Your kindness be upon us,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: as we have waited for You.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: Remember not the sins of our ancestors;
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 98_Paragraph: let Your mercy come swiftly toward us
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: for we have been brought very low.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Be gracious to us, Adonoy, be gracious to us
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: for we are saturated with humiliation.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 102_Paragraph: [Even] in anger remember to have compassion.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: For He knows of what we are made;
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 104_Paragraph: He is mindful that we are but dust.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 105_Paragraph: Help us, God of our deliverance,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: for the sake of the glory of Your Name;
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 107_Paragraph: save us and atone our sins,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: in the world which He created
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 113_Paragraph: and may He rule His kingdom
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: and in the lifetime of the entire House of Israel,
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 116_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 123_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 127_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 130_Paragraph: of the entire House of Israel
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: May there be abundant peace from heaven
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: He Who makes peace in His high heavens
text.0_First Day, 9_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: may He, make peace for us
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: may they continue to praise You, Selah.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Fortunate is the people whose lot is thus;
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: for whom Adonoy is their God.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: I will exalt You, my God, the King,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and bless Your Name forever and ever.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Every day I will bless You
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and extol Your Name forever and ever.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Adonoy is great and highly extolled,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The splendor of Your glorious majesty,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: and the words of Your wonders I will speak.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Of Your awesome might, they will speak
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and Your greatness I will recount.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: They will make mention of Your bountifulness,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: and joyfully exult in Your righteousness.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: slow to anger and great in kindliness.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: His mercy encompasses all His works.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: All Your works will thank You, Adonoy,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and Your pious ones will bless You.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Of the honor of Your kingship, they will speak
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: and Your might they will declare.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: To reveal to men His mighty acts,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: and the glorious splendor of His kingship.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Your kingship is the kingship for all times,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: and Your dominion is in every generation.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: The eyes of all look expectantly to You,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: their food at its proper time.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: and satisfy the desire of every living being.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Adonoy is just in all His ways
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: and benevolent in all His deeds.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: The will of those who fear Him He fulfills;
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: He hears their cry and delivers them.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: Adonoy watches over all those who love Him,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: and will destroy all the wicked.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Praise of Adonoy my mouth will declare,
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: His holy Name forever and ever.
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name

text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,

text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.1_Second Day, 0_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: And how can we justify ourselves?
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Let us search into our ways and examine them,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: for Your right hand is extended
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Not with virtue nor with good deeds
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: but like the poor and needy
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: At Your door, do we knock,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Please do not turn us away empty-handed
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: unto You does all flesh come.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: to prostrate themselves before You, Adonoy.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: They will come and prostrate themselves
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and they will give honor to Your Name.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Come let us prostrate ourselves and bow;
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let us kneel before Adonoy, our Maker.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: give thanks to Him, bless His Name.

text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: toward Your Holy Sanctuary in awe of You.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: who stand in the House of Adonoy

text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: for Adonoy our God is holy.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: tremble before Him all [peoples of] the earth.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: and give thanks to Your Name
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: for Your kindness and for Your truth;

text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and until the skies is Your truth.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: For great is Adonoy and most highly extolled,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: and awesome is He above all gods.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: For a great Almighty is Adonoy
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: and a great King over all gods.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: For who is so mighty in heaven or on earth
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Who would not fear You, King of nations?
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: For to You it is fitting;
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: for among all the wise ones of the nations,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: There is none like You, Adonoy
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 89_Paragraph: and great is Your Name in might.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: Yours is an arm with might
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: Yours is the day, also Yours is the night,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: For in His hands are the depths of the earth,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: and the heights of the mountains are His.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: Who can recount the mighty deeds of Adonoy,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: or cause to be heard all His praise?
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: is the greatness, the might, the glory,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: for all that is in heaven and on earth [is Yours];
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: the inhabited world and its fullness;
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;

text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.1_Second Day, 1_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: when it raises its waves, You still them.
