text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: for we have been brought very low.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: The sins of our youth and our transgressions,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: for they are from the beginning of the world.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: which You have acquired of old,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: this mountain of Zion where You have dwelled.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Remember, Adonoy, the affection of Jerusalem,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: the love of Zion, forget not until eternity.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: to the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: “Raze it, raze it to its very foundations.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: for it is time to be gracious to her,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: for the appointed time has come.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: to whom You swore by Your very Self,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: as the stars of the heavens;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: and all this land that I have promised,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: I will give to your descendants,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: and they will inherit it forever.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: do not regard the stubborness of this people,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: or their wickedness, or their sin.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: wherein we have acted foolishly and sinned.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: Remember to us the covenant of the Patriarchs,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: “And I will remember my covenant with Jacob,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and also my covenant with Isaac,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: and also my covenant with Abraham
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: and the land I will remember.
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: Remember to us the covenant of the ancestors,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: “And I will remember for their sake,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: in the sight of the nations;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: Do unto us as You promised,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: when they are in the land of their enemies,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: and I will not abhor them, to destroy them,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: to annul My covenant with them;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: for I am Adonoy, their God.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: Be accessible to us when we seek You,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: you will seek Adonoy, your God,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah:
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: “And Adonoy, your God will open your heart,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: and the heart of your descendants,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: and cleanse us, as it is written:
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: as a thick cloud and as a mist,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: “I have swept away like a thick cloud
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 98_Paragraph: and like a mist, your sins;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: return to Me, for I have redeemed You.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Blot out our transgressions for Your sake,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 105_Paragraph: and your sins, I will not recall.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: Make our sins as white as snow or wool,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: though your sins be as scarlet,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: they shall be as white as snow;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: though they be red as crimson,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: Have compassion on us and do not destroy us,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 116_Paragraph: “For an Almighty of mercy is Adonoy,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: He will not abandon you or destroy you,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Gather our dispersed ones, as it is written:
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 124_Paragraph: are in the farthermost part of heaven,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 125_Paragraph: from there Adonoy, your God will gather you,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: and from there He will take you.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 131_Paragraph: your captivity and have compassion on you;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: and He will again gather you
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 134_Paragraph: where Adonoy, your God has scattered you.”
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: Bring us to Your holy mountain,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: and make us joyful in Your House of Prayer,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: “And I will bring them to My holy mountain,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: and make them joyful in My House of Prayer;
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: will be accepted with favor on My Altar,
text.1_Second Day, 5_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: will be called a House of Prayer
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: our hearts are miserable with our sins;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: [the place of] our desire has been devastated,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: our Palace has become a desolation,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: our beautiful land belongs to strangers,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: Still, we have not repented our errors,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: so how can we be so insolent
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: “Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: we are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.1_Second Day, 6_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: But indeed we and our fathers have sinned:
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: may they continue to praise You, Selah.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Fortunate is the people whose lot is thus;
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: for whom Adonoy is their God.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: I will exalt You, my God, the King,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and bless Your Name forever and ever.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Every day I will bless You
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and extol Your Name forever and ever.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Adonoy is great and highly extolled,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The splendor of Your glorious majesty,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: and the words of Your wonders I will speak.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Of Your awesome might, they will speak
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and Your greatness I will recount.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: They will make mention of Your bountifulness,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: and joyfully exult in Your righteousness.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: slow to anger and great in kindliness.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: His mercy encompasses all His works.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: All Your works will thank You, Adonoy,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and Your pious ones will bless You.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Of the honor of Your kingship, they will speak
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: and Your might they will declare.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: To reveal to men His mighty acts,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: and the glorious splendor of His kingship.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Your kingship is the kingship for all times,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: and Your dominion is in every generation.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: The eyes of all look expectantly to You,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: their food at its proper time.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: and satisfy the desire of every living being.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Adonoy is just in all His ways
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: and benevolent in all His deeds.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: The will of those who fear Him He fulfills;
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: He hears their cry and delivers them.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: Adonoy watches over all those who love Him,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: and will destroy all the wicked.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Praise of Adonoy my mouth will declare,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: His holy Name forever and ever.
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: in the world which He created
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: and may He rule His kingdom
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: and in the lifetime of the entire House of Israel,
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.2_Third Day, 0_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: And how can we justify ourselves?
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Let us search into our ways and examine them,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: for Your right hand is extended
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Not with virtue nor with good deeds
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: but like the poor and needy
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: At Your door, do we knock,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Please do not turn us away empty-handed
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: unto You does all flesh come.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: to prostrate themselves before You, Adonoy.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: They will come and prostrate themselves
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and they will give honor to Your Name.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Come let us prostrate ourselves and bow;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let us kneel before Adonoy, our Maker.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: give thanks to Him, bless His Name.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: As for us, through Your abundant kindness
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: toward Your Holy Sanctuary in awe of You.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: who stand in the House of Adonoy
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Lift your hands to the Sanctuary
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Let us come to His Dwelling Places,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: let us prostrate ourselves at His footstool.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His footstool,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His holy mountain,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: for Adonoy our God is holy.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: tremble before Him all [peoples of] the earth.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: and give thanks to Your Name
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: for Your kindness and for Your truth;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Your word far beyond Your Name.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: who is like You, a mighty God;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and Your faithfulness is round about You.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: who can be likened to Adonoy
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: among the sons of the mighty?
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and until the skies is Your truth.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: For great is Adonoy and most highly extolled,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: and awesome is He above all gods.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: For a great Almighty is Adonoy
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: and a great King over all gods.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: For who is so mighty in heaven or on earth
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Who would not fear You, King of nations?
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: For to You it is fitting;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: for among all the wise ones of the nations,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: There is none like You, Adonoy
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 89_Paragraph: and great is Your Name in might.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: Yours is an arm with might
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: Yours is the day, also Yours is the night,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: For in His hands are the depths of the earth,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: and the heights of the mountains are His.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: Who can recount the mighty deeds of Adonoy,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: or cause to be heard all His praise?
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: is the greatness, the might, the glory,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: for all that is in heaven and on earth [is Yours];
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: the inhabited world and its fullness;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: You shattered the heads of sea monsters
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: when it raises its waves, You still them.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 120_Paragraph: in the city of our God,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts, God of Israel,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: in the great council of the holy ones
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 128_Paragraph: over all that are about Him.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 140_Paragraph: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: let us walk with the throngs.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: is the soul of every living thing,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 150_Paragraph: and the body is Your doing,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 158_Paragraph: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: You are Almighty, Slow to Anger,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 169_Paragraph: Lord of Mercy, You are called,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 170_Paragraph: and the way of repentance, You have taught us.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 171_Paragraph: The greatness of Your mercy and kindliness,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 172_Paragraph: remember this day and every day
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: for the descendants of Your loved ones.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 175_Paragraph: for You are the Lord of Mercy.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 179_Paragraph: to [Moses,] the modest one of old.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 181_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 182_Paragraph: In the shadow of Your wings,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 183_Paragraph: may we be sheltered and lodged,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 184_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 188_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 192_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 201_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness and Truth.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 206_Paragraph: And Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 207_Paragraph: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 208_Paragraph: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 209_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 210_Paragraph: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 214_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 215_Paragraph: Our God! we are ashamed with our deeds;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 216_Paragraph: we are disgraced with our iniquities.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 217_Paragraph: Our God! we are too ashamed and disgraced
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 218_Paragraph: to lift our faces to You, our God.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 219_Paragraph: Do not deal with us according to our sins,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 220_Paragraph: nor repay us according to our iniquities.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 221_Paragraph: If you God should take account of iniquities,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 224_Paragraph: in order that You be feared.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 225_Paragraph: Enter not into judgements with us,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 226_Paragraph: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 227_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 228_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 230_Paragraph: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 231_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 232_Paragraph: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 234_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 236_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 238_Paragraph: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 241_Paragraph: and as You forgave this people
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 242_Paragraph: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 246_Paragraph: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 247_Paragraph: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 248_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 249_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 250_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 251_Paragraph: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 252_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 253_Paragraph: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 254_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.2_Third Day, 1_Chapter, 258_Paragraph: over Your city and over Your people.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: This prayer was composed by Shlomo ben Yehuda, HaBavli
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God, and God of our fathers!
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Your ways are not like those of man,1Who cannot always fulfill his will.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: where, then, is Your vengeance2But since You can, why don’t You take revenge from our enemies.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: to serve You in Your cherished House—
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and she is unable to cleave unto You.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: how he has trampled upon me.”

text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: though she is exiled [from her land]
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The mother3This refers to the Congregation of Israel. is sent away—not divorced,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: the son, like a lost orphan—is sent off.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: She, who was likened to a closed-in garden,4Israel, who was protected by its Divine faith, has now been abandoned.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: has become abandoned like wild grass,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: and the foundation that was sealed
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: Formerly Your wrath lasted but a moment,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: but now the reverse is true.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: The [priests who wore the] holy crowns,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: are now cast into the streets.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: She, who was beloved of God, was beautiful
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: as one [a harlot] with painted eyes.5God considers our love to be insincere.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: She, who was of pleasing appearance,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: has become blackened by hard labor,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: The day of vengeance—its path is yet closed;
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: the window is yet sealed.6The time of redemption is concealed from our view.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: Our endurance is weakened by the burden;7Of exile.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: crippled and lame are the survivors of death.
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: Without rest, they stray and wander,
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: they labor and strive, while others reap.

text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: in the rich, fertile land [of Israel].

text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: why does He let His plant be trampled
text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: by the bulls of Bashan [Israel’s enemies].

text.2_Third Day, 2_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: but her waiting time is prolonged.

text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: This prayer was composed by Shlomo ben Yehuda, HaBavli
text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: In the day of dread, I call upon You.
text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Let me not be oppressed by the insolent—
text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: those who forsake the precious Torah.
text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: Render to them their just deserts;

text.2_Third Day, 3_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: the best of our people have been destroyed.

text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: our hearts are miserable with our sins;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: [the place of] our desire has been devastated,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: our Palace has become a desolation,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: our beautiful land belongs to strangers,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: Still, we have not repented our errors,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: so how can we be so insolent
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: “Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: we are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.2_Third Day, 6_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: But indeed we and our fathers have sinned:
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: may they continue to praise You, Selah.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Fortunate is the people whose lot is thus;
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: for whom Adonoy is their God.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: I will exalt You, my God, the King,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and bless Your Name forever and ever.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Every day I will bless You
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and extol Your Name forever and ever.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Adonoy is great and highly extolled,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The splendor of Your glorious majesty,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: and the words of Your wonders I will speak.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Of Your awesome might, they will speak
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and Your greatness I will recount.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: They will make mention of Your bountifulness,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: and joyfully exult in Your righteousness.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: slow to anger and great in kindliness.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: His mercy encompasses all His works.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: All Your works will thank You, Adonoy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and Your pious ones will bless You.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Of the honor of Your kingship, they will speak
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: and Your might they will declare.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: To reveal to men His mighty acts,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: and the glorious splendor of His kingship.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Your kingship is the kingship for all times,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: and Your dominion is in every generation.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: The eyes of all look expectantly to You,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: their food at its proper time.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: and satisfy the desire of every living being.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Adonoy is just in all His ways
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: and benevolent in all His deeds.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: The will of those who fear Him He fulfills;
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: He hears their cry and delivers them.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: Adonoy watches over all those who love Him,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: and will destroy all the wicked.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Praise of Adonoy my mouth will declare,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: His holy Name forever and ever.
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: in the world which He created
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: and may He rule His kingdom
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: and in the lifetime of the entire House of Israel,
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.3_Fourth Day, 0_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: And how can we justify ourselves?
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Let us search into our ways and examine them,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: for Your right hand is extended
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Not with virtue nor with good deeds
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: but like the poor and needy
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: At Your door, do we knock,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Please do not turn us away empty-handed
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: unto You does all flesh come.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: to prostrate themselves before You, Adonoy.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: They will come and prostrate themselves
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and they will give honor to Your Name.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Come let us prostrate ourselves and bow;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let us kneel before Adonoy, our Maker.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: give thanks to Him, bless His Name.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: As for us, through Your abundant kindness
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: toward Your Holy Sanctuary in awe of You.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: who stand in the House of Adonoy
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Lift your hands to the Sanctuary
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Let us come to His Dwelling Places,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: let us prostrate ourselves at His footstool.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His footstool,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His holy mountain,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: for Adonoy our God is holy.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: tremble before Him all [peoples of] the earth.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: and give thanks to Your Name
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: for Your kindness and for Your truth;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Your word far beyond Your Name.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: who is like You, a mighty God;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and Your faithfulness is round about You.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: who can be likened to Adonoy
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: among the sons of the mighty?
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and until the skies is Your truth.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: For great is Adonoy and most highly extolled,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: and awesome is He above all gods.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: For a great Almighty is Adonoy
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: and a great King over all gods.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: For who is so mighty in heaven or on earth
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Who would not fear You, King of nations?
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: For to You it is fitting;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: for among all the wise ones of the nations,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: There is none like You, Adonoy
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 89_Paragraph: and great is Your Name in might.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: Yours is an arm with might
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: Yours is the day, also Yours is the night,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: For in His hands are the depths of the earth,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: and the heights of the mountains are His.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: Who can recount the mighty deeds of Adonoy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: or cause to be heard all His praise?
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: is the greatness, the might, the glory,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: for all that is in heaven and on earth [is Yours];
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: the inhabited world and its fullness;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: You shattered the heads of sea monsters
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: when it raises its waves, You still them.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 120_Paragraph: in the city of our God,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts, God of Israel,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: in the great council of the holy ones
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 128_Paragraph: over all that are about Him.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 140_Paragraph: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: let us walk with the throngs.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: is the soul of every living thing,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 150_Paragraph: and the body is Your doing,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 158_Paragraph: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: You are Almighty, Slow to Anger,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 169_Paragraph: Lord of Mercy, You are called,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 170_Paragraph: and the way of repentance, You have taught us.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 171_Paragraph: The greatness of Your mercy and kindliness,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 172_Paragraph: remember this day and every day
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: for the descendants of Your loved ones.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 175_Paragraph: for You are the Lord of Mercy.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 179_Paragraph: to [Moses,] the modest one of old.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 181_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 182_Paragraph: In the shadow of Your wings,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 183_Paragraph: may we be sheltered and lodged,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 184_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 188_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 192_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 201_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness and Truth.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 206_Paragraph: And Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 207_Paragraph: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 208_Paragraph: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 209_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 210_Paragraph: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 214_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 215_Paragraph: Adonoy is good to those who hope for Him,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 216_Paragraph: to the soul who seeks Him.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 217_Paragraph: Our humiliation is before us all the day,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 218_Paragraph: our faces are covered with shame.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 219_Paragraph: We are murdered for Your sake, all the day,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 220_Paragraph: we are considered like sheep for slaughter.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 221_Paragraph: Yet our hearts are not turned away,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 222_Paragraph: nor are our feet moved from Your path.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 223_Paragraph: For He is concerned for the bloodshed,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 225_Paragraph: He has not forgotten the cry of the humble.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 226_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 227_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 229_Paragraph: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 230_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 231_Paragraph: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 233_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 235_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 237_Paragraph: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 240_Paragraph: and as You forgave this people
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 241_Paragraph: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 245_Paragraph: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 246_Paragraph: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 247_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 248_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 249_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 250_Paragraph: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 251_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 252_Paragraph: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 253_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.3_Fourth Day, 1_Chapter, 257_Paragraph: over Your city and over Your people.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: that the Almighty will answer me.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: as a beggar at the door.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Behold, You have been from long ago
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: why must I die of persecution and hardship?
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: and establish the site of my Temple.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: You are good to those who hope in You,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: to the soul who seeks You.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: We wait for You, in time of trouble—
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: We are slaughtered for Your sake all the day,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the sake of Your holy Name;
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: yet our hearts are not turned away
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: We are consumed with fear from Your hand,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: we are like an empty vessel,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: We are put in the hands of cruel masters
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: until Adonoy looks down and sees

text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: they cut off our lives, spilling our blood,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: pay them according to their deeds,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: for He Who is concerned for the bloodshed,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: Bring us back to You and rescind Your anger,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: lift us up from our low state,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: and let us not be in disgrace;
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: when You record us, who yearn for Your glory,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: inscribe us for life in Your book.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: whose hands and knees are weak,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: clear a way for Your people
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: He removes their sins one by one,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: to the humble Moses of old,
text.3_Fourth Day, 2_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.

text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Gershom ben Yehudah (the Light of the Exile).
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: of which our fathers told us,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: When Israel went down to Egypt
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: with cords of humanity, You drew them—1Jacob and his sons were drawn to Egypt to see Joseph.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Even those who enslaved them with hard labor,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: who decreed their males be cast in the river,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: You judged them measure for measure;
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: You brought out the bannered hosts
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: with a wealth of all desired gifts.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: and they crossed it on foot,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: You sustained them in the wilderness,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: and they were pursued by their oppressors,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: they cried to You and You heard them,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: and You appointed deliverers for them.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: When they lived in the land,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: they sinned and were exiled [to Babylon],
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: You remembered to redeem after seventy years.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: and were left to be trampled,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: they were forced out of their land,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: and the time of their return is concealed;
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: they live among the nations as bondsmen.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: by the heavy and bitter catastrophe;
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: still feeling the pain of the first calamity2The destruction of the First Temple.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: she was quickly struck a second below.3The destruction of the Second Temple.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: From day to day my trouble increases,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: each new day is worse than yesterday.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: are hard pressed by the cruel enemy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: that they would exchange their faith in God
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: shall I call [upon You] in distress?
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: for Your hand is not lacking.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 58_Paragraph: If the gravity of our transgressions
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: have created a barrier between You and us,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: if the curtain has shut out [our] prayer;
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: Mighty God, beneath Your throne of glory,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: that our cry come before You,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: that it be accepted before Your glory.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: gather my scattered ones, and go before me,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: against those that strive against my soul;
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 70_Paragraph: please save me, my holy God.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 71_Paragraph: Break the teeth of the wicked with gravel,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: may they be childless, their wives widows,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: let their blood be spilled on the ground,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: release those who are prepared to die4For Your sake.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: of the tabernacle of David which is fallen,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: which is lowered to the dust.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Comfort her in captivity with double measure,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: brighten her light and lighten her darkness.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: Build Your city as in the days of old,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: restore Your Altar, Temple, and Entrance Hall,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: then will Judah and Israel worship You there,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: and Your Name will be magnified forever.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 93_Paragraph: He removes their sins one by one,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 104_Paragraph: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: to the humble Moses of old,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: and Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 123_Paragraph: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 124_Paragraph: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 125_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.3_Fourth Day, 3_Chapter, 130_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: You search all things and review them,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: if perchance, I have dealt falsely
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: please, do not investigate my iniquity,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: and do not examine my misdeeds.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: Adonoy! Hear my voice in the morning.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: With a span, He measures the heavens above;
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: for You, I prepare a crown [with my prayers]
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: offered to You in the third watch5The last watch which culminates at daybreak, the period most appropriate for prayer. [of night]
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: during which You give ear to the entreaties
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: of those who hope for Your deliverance.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: and say “There is none else but her.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: And the Place where incense was offered,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and the Holy of Holies and the Altar,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: with which the Kohanim served You,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: they [our enemies] have made a thoroughfare.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: as the liver to the lobe,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: and every wound and sickness befall them.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: Adonoy! Hear my voice in the morning.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Your Name is Almighty of Vengeance,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: why do You appear as asleep?
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: the vine which Your right hand planted
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Your people are nick-named with degradation
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: but in fact are not degraded.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: for no sentence is passed without justice.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: But take vengence for the [Torah of] faith
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: which was given from Your right hand,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: and in which it is written: “Who can count.”6See Numbers 23:10, “Who can count the dust of Jacob.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Yet now we are counted like sheep;
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: my Rock, be aroused, I beg You
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: destroy our enemy from its base,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: Adonoy! Hear my voice in the morning.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: Who is near to those who call Him
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and hears [the prayers of] the needy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: judge the plight of the poor and needy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: The fate of high and the low
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: are in Your hands, Master of masters.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: Let my sentence come from You
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: as a bright light, Almighty of faithfulness.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: The Almighty is not like man
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: that He should change His word,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: set free the [Hebrew] bondsman”;7See Exodus 21:2.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: and many times six years have gone by me
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: although I have not loved my masters.8See Exodus 21. The servant could opt to remain in the service of his master if he loved him.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: And if I was sold to a heathen,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: and was not released after [six] years,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: the duty of ransom falls on the kinsman,
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: and You are my Kinsman and Redeemer.
text.3_Fourth Day, 4_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: Adonoy! Hear my voice in the morning.
