text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: Remember not the sins of our ancestors;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: let Your compassion come swiftly toward us,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: for we have been brought very low.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: The sins of our youth and our transgressions,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: for they are from the beginning of the world.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: which You have acquired of old,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: this mountain of Zion where You have dwelled.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Remember, Adonoy, the affection of Jerusalem,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: the love of Zion, forget not until eternity.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: to the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: “Raze it, raze it to its very foundations.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: for it is time to be gracious to her,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: for the appointed time has come.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: to whom You swore by Your very Self,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: as the stars of the heavens;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: and all this land that I have promised,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: I will give to your descendants,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: and they will inherit it forever.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: do not regard the stubborness of this people,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: or their wickedness, or their sin.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: wherein we have acted foolishly and sinned.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: Remember to us the covenant of the Patriarchs,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: “And I will remember my covenant with Jacob,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and also my covenant with Isaac,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: and also my covenant with Abraham
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: and the land I will remember.
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: Remember to us the covenant of the ancestors,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: “And I will remember for their sake,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: in the sight of the nations;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: Do unto us as You promised,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: when they are in the land of their enemies,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: and I will not abhor them, to destroy them,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: to annul My covenant with them;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: for I am Adonoy, their God.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: Be accessible to us when we seek You,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: you will seek Adonoy, your God,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah:
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: “And Adonoy, your God will open your heart,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: and the heart of your descendants,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: and cleanse us, as it is written:
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: as a thick cloud and as a mist,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: “I have swept away like a thick cloud
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 98_Paragraph: and like a mist, your sins;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: return to Me, for I have redeemed You.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Blot out our transgressions for Your sake,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 105_Paragraph: and your sins, I will not recall.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: Make our sins as white as snow or wool,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: though your sins be as scarlet,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: they shall be as white as snow;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: though they be red as crimson,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: Have compassion on us and do not destroy us,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 116_Paragraph: “For an Almighty of mercy is Adonoy,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: He will not abandon you or destroy you,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Gather our dispersed ones, as it is written:
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 124_Paragraph: are in the farthermost part of heaven,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 125_Paragraph: from there Adonoy, your God will gather you,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: and from there He will take you.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 131_Paragraph: your captivity and have compassion on you;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: and He will again gather you
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 134_Paragraph: where Adonoy, your God has scattered you.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: Bring us to Your holy mountain,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: and make us joyful in Your House of Prayer,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: “And I will bring them to My holy mountain,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: and make them joyful in My House of Prayer;
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: will be accepted with favor on My Altar,
text.3_Fourth Day, 5_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: will be called a House of Prayer
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: our hearts are miserable with our sins;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: [the place of] our desire has been devastated,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: our Palace has become a desolation,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: our beautiful land belongs to strangers,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: Still, we have not repented our errors,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: so how can we be so insolent
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: “Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: we are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.3_Fourth Day, 6_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: But indeed we and our fathers have sinned:
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: may they continue to praise You, Selah.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: Fortunate is the people whose lot is thus;
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: for whom Adonoy is their God.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: I will exalt You, my God, the King,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and bless Your Name forever and ever.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Every day I will bless You
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and extol Your Name forever and ever.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Adonoy is great and highly extolled,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: The splendor of Your glorious majesty,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: and the words of Your wonders I will speak.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: Of Your awesome might, they will speak
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and Your greatness I will recount.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: They will make mention of Your bountifulness,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: and joyfully exult in Your righteousness.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: slow to anger and great in kindliness.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: His mercy encompasses all His works.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: All Your works will thank You, Adonoy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and Your pious ones will bless You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Of the honor of Your kingship, they will speak
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: and Your might they will declare.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: To reveal to men His mighty acts,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: and the glorious splendor of His kingship.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: Your kingship is the kingship for all times,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: and Your dominion is in every generation.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: The eyes of all look expectantly to You,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: their food at its proper time.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: and satisfy the desire of every living being.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Adonoy is just in all His ways
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: and benevolent in all His deeds.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: The will of those who fear Him He fulfills;
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: He hears their cry and delivers them.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: Adonoy watches over all those who love Him,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: and will destroy all the wicked.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: Praise of Adonoy my mouth will declare,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: His holy Name forever and ever.
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: in the world which He created
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: and may He rule His kingdom
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 60_Paragraph: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: and in the lifetime of the entire House of Israel,
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: speedily and in the near future—
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: May His great Name be blessed
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.4_Fifth Day, 0_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: And how can we justify ourselves?
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Let us search into our ways and examine them,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: for Your right hand is extended
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: Not with virtue nor with good deeds
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: but like the poor and needy
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: At Your door, do we knock,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: Please do not turn us away empty-handed
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: unto You does all flesh come.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: to prostrate themselves before You, Adonoy.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: They will come and prostrate themselves
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: and they will give honor to Your Name.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Come let us prostrate ourselves and bow;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let us kneel before Adonoy, our Maker.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: give thanks to Him, bless His Name.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: As for us, through Your abundant kindness
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: toward Your Holy Sanctuary in awe of You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: who stand in the House of Adonoy
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: Lift your hands to the Sanctuary
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: Let us come to His Dwelling Places,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: let us prostrate ourselves at His footstool.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His footstool,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and prostrate yourselves at His holy mountain,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: for Adonoy our God is holy.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: tremble before Him all [peoples of] the earth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: and give thanks to Your Name
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: for Your kindness and for Your truth;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Your word far beyond Your Name.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: who is like You, a mighty God;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and Your faithfulness is round about You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: who can be likened to Adonoy
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: among the sons of the mighty?
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and until the skies is Your truth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: For great is Adonoy and most highly extolled,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: and awesome is He above all gods.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: For a great Almighty is Adonoy
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: and a great King over all gods.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: For who is so mighty in heaven or on earth
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 82_Paragraph: Who would not fear You, King of nations?
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: For to You it is fitting;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: for among all the wise ones of the nations,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: There is none like You, Adonoy
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 89_Paragraph: and great is Your Name in might.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: Yours is an arm with might
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: Yours is the day, also Yours is the night,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: For in His hands are the depths of the earth,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: and the heights of the mountains are His.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: Who can recount the mighty deeds of Adonoy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 97_Paragraph: or cause to be heard all His praise?
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: is the greatness, the might, the glory,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: for all that is in heaven and on earth [is Yours];
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: the inhabited world and its fullness;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: You shattered the heads of sea monsters
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: when it raises its waves, You still them.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 120_Paragraph: in the city of our God,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts, God of Israel,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: in the great council of the holy ones
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 128_Paragraph: over all that are about Him.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 140_Paragraph: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: let us walk with the throngs.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: is the soul of every living thing,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 150_Paragraph: and the body is Your doing,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 158_Paragraph: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: You are Almighty, Slow to Anger,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 169_Paragraph: Lord of Mercy, You are called,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 170_Paragraph: and the way of repentance, You have taught us.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 171_Paragraph: The greatness of Your mercy and kindliness,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 172_Paragraph: remember this day and every day
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: for the descendants of Your loved ones.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 175_Paragraph: for You are the Lord of Mercy.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 179_Paragraph: to [Moses,] the modest one of old.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 181_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 182_Paragraph: In the shadow of Your wings,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 183_Paragraph: may we be sheltered and lodged,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 184_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 188_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 192_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 201_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness and Truth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 206_Paragraph: And Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 207_Paragraph: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 208_Paragraph: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 209_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 210_Paragraph: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 214_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 216_Paragraph: and let Your mind be changed
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 217_Paragraph: concerning the evil intended for Your people.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 218_Paragraph: Turn for the sake of Your servants,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 221_Paragraph: to the myriads and thousands of Israel.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 224_Paragraph: Return, return, You said to us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 226_Paragraph: You promised to accept it from the beginning.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 227_Paragraph: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 229_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 230_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 231_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 233_Paragraph: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 234_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 235_Paragraph: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 237_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 239_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 241_Paragraph: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 244_Paragraph: and as You forgave this people
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 245_Paragraph: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 249_Paragraph: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 250_Paragraph: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 251_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 252_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 253_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 254_Paragraph: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 255_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 256_Paragraph: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 257_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.4_Fifth Day, 1_Chapter, 261_Paragraph: over Your city and over Your people.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Your people Israel set prayers [before You],
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: for they are in distress and need deliverance;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: their adversaries add to the yoke [of exile],
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: they have been humiliated from their youth,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and it has not been removed from them;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Holy One, it is in Your hand
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: according to Your pure attribute [of mercy],
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: which adorns Him like a cloak [of royalty],
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: from the wound itself, He prepares the cure;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: with Your great strength and outstretched arm.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: You uplifted and exalted [Your people Israel]
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: [we beseech You therefore] to eradicate the counsel of the wicked
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: and to annul their [evil] plans against us;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: and let the cruel angel thrust them
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: For the sake of Your honor,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: and Your holy Name, that is greatly extolled,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: lest [Your Name] be desecrated among nations;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: lead their advisors and men of power
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: Raise up the poor from the dust
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: and the needy from the dunghills,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: let them not be destroyed and humiliated;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: if she has been casual regarding Your precepts
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: be covered over by Your love.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: They are most precious in Your Presence,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: Let Your mercy go before them,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: God of the high and lowly
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 50_Paragraph: before they are drowned in the wicked flood.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: They desire Your nearness above all else,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: to bring the deliverance that was prophesied.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: let them be a sign of [Your] beneficence.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: Strong and mighty is their redeemer—
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 61_Paragraph: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: He removes their sins one by one,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: to the humble Moses of old,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 91_Paragraph: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 93_Paragraph: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 95_Paragraph: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Unto You, Adonoy, we lift up our souls.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 101_Paragraph: We lift our hearts with our hands
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: For Your sake, we are murdered all the day,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 104_Paragraph: we are considered as sheep for the slaughter.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: Why do You appear as asleep, my Master?
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 107_Paragraph: Awaken, do not forsake us forever.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: Why do You conceal Your Presence,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: For our souls are bowed to the dust,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: our bowels cling to the earth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: and redeem us for the sake of Your kindness.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 116_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 120_Paragraph: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 2_Chapter, 124_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.

text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: God, You are known to be great in Israel,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: whenever we call unto You, You are near to us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: You are exalted and uplifted in our midst.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 5_Paragraph: You have granted us good favors
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: and the uprightness of our hearts;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: even though we have forsaken You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Redeem us, for we are slaves.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: we have been brought to the crushing point,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: of those who yearn for You,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: and where is Your earlier kindness with us?
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: For ever and ever, they are everlasting.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: We carry the burden of Your wrath,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: and it has weakened our might,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: Adonoy, do not rebuke us with Your anger,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 21_Paragraph: terrifying panic has consumed our flesh;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: please, do not chastise us with Your rage.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: Our suffering from distress is indescribable,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: who can weigh them and who can count them?
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: We know our wickedness, that we have sinned,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: May [Your] anger and wrath cease from us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: for [the nation of] Jacob is small and frail,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: let us be relieved from oppression,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: and let the yoke of tyranny be crushed,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 32_Paragraph: for our strength to endure is weakened.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: Do not use the measure [of our evil ways
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: as a yardstick] to exact punishment from us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: for we remain but a few from many;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: rescind the evil intended for Your people,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: for tipping the scale towards kindness
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: even if our sins testify against us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: help us; for on You, we depend;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: bend our necks to serve You,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: may we serve and honor You.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: have prepared and set aside days of fasting,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: their perception has become so shrunken—
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: they are unable to ask for their needs;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: may the outpourings of their prayers
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: The voice of Jacob cries out
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: from the depths of Your exile,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: may it be heard in the heavens,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 57_Paragraph: destroy with Your anger, their pursuers.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 59_Paragraph: for those who strive against Zion,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: You acquired us in our youth,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: do not cast us off in our old age;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: we have gone astray leftward [the way of sin]
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 65_Paragraph: let Your right hand bring us near,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 66_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 67_Paragraph: Look down and gaze [at our trouble]
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: and look after Your loved ones,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 70_Paragraph: and be garbed with Your righteousness,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: and be enwrapped with Your kindliness,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: and let there appear before You
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: the attributes of Your goodness and humility.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: He removes their sins one by one,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 83_Paragraph: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 90_Paragraph: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 92_Paragraph: to the humble Moses of old,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 103_Paragraph: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: and Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 3_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,

text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;

text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.4_Fifth Day, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;

text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 108_Paragraph: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 109_Paragraph: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 115_Paragraph: You shattered the heads of sea monsters
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 117_Paragraph: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: when it raises its waves, You still them.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 119_Paragraph: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 120_Paragraph: in the city of our God,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts, God of Israel,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: in the great council of the holy ones
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 128_Paragraph: over all that are about Him.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 129_Paragraph: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 133_Paragraph: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 137_Paragraph: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 140_Paragraph: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: let us walk with the throngs.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 144_Paragraph: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 145_Paragraph: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 147_Paragraph: is the soul of every living thing,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 148_Paragraph: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 150_Paragraph: and the body is Your doing,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 152_Paragraph: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 154_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 155_Paragraph: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 157_Paragraph: for the sake of Your Name.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 158_Paragraph: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 161_Paragraph: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 162_Paragraph: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 168_Paragraph: You are Almighty, Slow to Anger,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 169_Paragraph: Lord of Mercy, You are called,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 170_Paragraph: and the way of repentance, You have taught us.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 171_Paragraph: The greatness of Your mercy and kindliness,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 172_Paragraph: remember this day and every day
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 173_Paragraph: for the descendants of Your loved ones.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 175_Paragraph: for You are the Lord of Mercy.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 179_Paragraph: to [Moses,] the modest one of old.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 181_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 182_Paragraph: In the shadow of Your wings,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 183_Paragraph: may we be sheltered and lodged,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 184_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 188_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 192_Paragraph: as on the day [of which it is said:]

text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 206_Paragraph: And Acquitter of those who repent.”

text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 214_Paragraph: to all who call upon You.

text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 219_Paragraph: but from Adonoy comes eloquent speech.

text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 228_Paragraph: and trods over the high places on earth.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 229_Paragraph: Adonoy, God of Hosts is His Name.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 230_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 231_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 233_Paragraph: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 234_Paragraph: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 235_Paragraph: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 237_Paragraph: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 239_Paragraph: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 241_Paragraph: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 244_Paragraph: and as You forgave this people
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 245_Paragraph: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 249_Paragraph: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 250_Paragraph: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 251_Paragraph: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 252_Paragraph: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 253_Paragraph: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 254_Paragraph: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 255_Paragraph: but because of Your great mercy.
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 256_Paragraph: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 257_Paragraph: My Master, listen and take action,
text.5_Sixth Day, 1_Chapter, 261_Paragraph: over Your city and over Your people.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God, and God of our fathers!
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: I will call with Your Name,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: I will strengthen myself to grasp You,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 4_Paragraph: my prayer precedes the morning watch,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: I approach the Ark to speak clear words,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: I have prepared my speech with great care
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: so that my lips may move freely.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: that God will give ear and answer me,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: but where is the competent petitioner
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: to say, “I have cleansed my heart
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: and the work of my hands is clean?”
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: let their prayer be esteemed as an offering
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 20_Paragraph: and their supplication as sweet incense.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: that they may lift up their heads,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: let no sins be found in them,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 24_Paragraph: neither secret ones or public ones.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Be a stronghold in times of distress
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: for those who trust in You;
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: do not banish into exile, the wanderers,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: place into Your bottle, the tears
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: with which I cause my couch to melt,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: let my strength be in You,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 33_Paragraph: Rescue them and bring them relief,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: they cry to You, they knock at Your door,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: they call upon You in distress with prayer,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: they have been robbed by thieves,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: the wicked have surrounded the righteous.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: why have You concealed Your Presence?
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: for the knowers of Your secrets—1The Torah.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 45_Paragraph: may Your kindness be reserved, always.
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: raise up the lowly to the heights,
text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: and bring the dejected up [to Jerusalem].

text.5_Sixth Day, 2_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: “Adonoy has done great things for them,

text.5_Sixth Day, 3_Chapter, 18_Paragraph: for we have been brought very low.

text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: our hearts are miserable with our sins;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: [the place of] our desire has been devastated,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: our Palace has become a desolation,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: our beautiful land belongs to strangers,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: Still, we have not repented our errors,
text.5_Sixth Day, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: so how can we be so insolent

text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 217_Paragraph: how long shall the wicked rejoice?
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 218_Paragraph: Against Your people they plot deceitfully,
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 219_Paragraph: they conspire against those sheltered by You.
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 220_Paragraph: They have given the corpse of Your servants
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 221_Paragraph: as food to the birds of the heavens;
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 222_Paragraph: the flesh of Your pious ones
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 223_Paragraph: to the beasts of the earth.
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 224_Paragraph: They have no mercy on infants.
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 225_Paragraph: nor do their eyes pity young children.
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 226_Paragraph: Pour out Your wrath upon them,
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 227_Paragraph: and may Your fierce anger overtake them.
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 228_Paragraph: For You will again bring us life,
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 229_Paragraph: and Your people will rejoice in You.
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 230_Paragraph: As a father has compassion on his children
text.6_Seventh Day, 1_Chapter, 231_Paragraph: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.

text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: The glory of the honored [Israel] has ceased,
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: who was once a proud ruler.
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: She who was protected like a delicate rose,
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: The praiseworthy one has been vilified
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: cast aside like a niddah,2A woman in menstruation is prohibited from being intimate with her husband.
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: impure as a metzorah.3A spiritual disease, often mistakenly interpreted as leprosy.

text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: The degenerate rules over the prince,

text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: save him who is called by Your Name;

text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: overlook the stench of his sins,

text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: sound the war-cry, shout like a warrior;
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: the lost ones, the remote ones—

text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: gather them, give them rest, uplift them,
text.6_Seventh Day, 3_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: take them up from the pit.

text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: do not regard the stubborness of this people,

text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 68_Paragraph: for I am Adonoy, their God.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 69_Paragraph: Be accessible to us when we seek You,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: you will seek Adonoy, your God,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 79_Paragraph: as it is written in Your Torah:
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: “And Adonoy, your God will open your heart,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: and the heart of your descendants,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 87_Paragraph: and cleanse us, as it is written:
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 88_Paragraph: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 94_Paragraph: as a thick cloud and as a mist,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 96_Paragraph: “I have swept away like a thick cloud
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 98_Paragraph: and like a mist, your sins;
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 99_Paragraph: return to Me, for I have redeemed You.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 100_Paragraph: Blot out our transgressions for Your sake,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 105_Paragraph: and your sins, I will not recall.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 106_Paragraph: Make our sins as white as snow or wool,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 110_Paragraph: though your sins be as scarlet,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 111_Paragraph: they shall be as white as snow;
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 112_Paragraph: though they be red as crimson,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 114_Paragraph: Have compassion on us and do not destroy us,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 116_Paragraph: “For an Almighty of mercy is Adonoy,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 118_Paragraph: He will not abandon you or destroy you,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 122_Paragraph: Gather our dispersed ones, as it is written:
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 124_Paragraph: are in the farthermost part of heaven,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 125_Paragraph: from there Adonoy, your God will gather you,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 126_Paragraph: and from there He will take you.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 131_Paragraph: your captivity and have compassion on you;
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 132_Paragraph: and He will again gather you
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 134_Paragraph: where Adonoy, your God has scattered you.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 135_Paragraph: Bring us to Your holy mountain,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 136_Paragraph: and make us joyful in Your House of Prayer,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 138_Paragraph: “And I will bring them to My holy mountain,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 139_Paragraph: and make them joyful in My House of Prayer;
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 141_Paragraph: will be accepted with favor on My Altar,
text.6_Seventh Day, 5_Chapter, 143_Paragraph: will be called a House of Prayer
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragraph: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragraph: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragraph: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragraph: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragraph: and we shall find the way back;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragraph: renew our days as of old.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragraph: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragraph: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragraph: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragraph: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragraph: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragraph: be not far removed from us.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragraph: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 16_Paragraph: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 17_Paragraph: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragraph: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragraph: for the words of our mouth,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragraph: and the meditation of our heart,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 25_Paragraph: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragraph: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragraph: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragraph: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragraph: let our prayer come before you
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragraph: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragraph: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragraph: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragraph: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragraph: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragraph: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragraph: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 39_Paragraph: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 40_Paragraph: We have caused others to sin;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragraph: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragraph: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragraph: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragraph: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragraph: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 47_Paragraph: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 48_Paragraph: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 49_Paragraph: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragraph: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 52_Paragraph: We have caused our friends grief;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragraph: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragraph: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragraph: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragraph: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragraph: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragraph: And You are the Righteous One
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragraph: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragraph: our hearts are miserable with our sins;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 73_Paragraph: [the place of] our desire has been devastated,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragraph: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 75_Paragraph: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragraph: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 77_Paragraph: our Palace has become a desolation,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 78_Paragraph: our beautiful land belongs to strangers,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 80_Paragraph: Still, we have not repented our errors,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragraph: so how can we be so insolent
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 84_Paragraph: “Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 85_Paragraph: we are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.6_Seventh Day, 6_Chapter, 86_Paragraph: But indeed we and our fathers have sinned:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 2_Paragr: may they continue to praise You, Selah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 3_Paragr: Fortunate is the people whose lot is thus;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 5_Paragr: for whom Adonoy is their God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 7_Paragr: I will exalt You, my God, the King,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 8_Paragr: and bless Your Name forever and ever.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 9_Paragr: Every day I will bless You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 10_Parag: and extol Your Name forever and ever.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 11_Parag: Adonoy is great and highly extolled,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 16_Parag: The splendor of Your glorious majesty,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 17_Parag: and the words of Your wonders I will speak.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 18_Parag: Of Your awesome might, they will speak
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 19_Parag: and Your greatness I will recount.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 20_Parag: They will make mention of Your bountifulness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 21_Parag: and joyfully exult in Your righteousness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 23_Parag: slow to anger and great in kindliness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 25_Parag: His mercy encompasses all His works.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 26_Parag: All Your works will thank You, Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 27_Parag: and Your pious ones will bless You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 28_Parag: Of the honor of Your kingship, they will speak
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 29_Parag: and Your might they will declare.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 30_Parag: To reveal to men His mighty acts,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 31_Parag: and the glorious splendor of His kingship.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 32_Parag: Your kingship is the kingship for all times,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 33_Parag: and Your dominion is in every generation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 36_Parag: The eyes of all look expectantly to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 38_Parag: their food at its proper time.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 40_Parag: and satisfy the desire of every living being.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 41_Parag: Adonoy is just in all His ways
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 42_Parag: and benevolent in all His deeds.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 43_Parag: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 44_Parag: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 45_Parag: The will of those who fear Him He fulfills;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 46_Parag: He hears their cry and delivers them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 47_Parag: Adonoy watches over all those who love Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 48_Parag: and will destroy all the wicked.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 49_Parag: Praise of Adonoy my mouth will declare,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 51_Parag: His holy Name forever and ever.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 56_Parag: Exalted and sanctified be His great Name
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 57_Parag: in the world which He created
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 59_Parag: and may He rule His kingdom
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 60_Parag: in your lifetime and in your days,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 61_Parag: and in the lifetime of the entire House of Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 62_Parag: speedily and in the near future—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 64_Parag: May His great Name be blessed
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 69_Parag: be the Name of the Holy One, blessed is He;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 0_Chapter, 73_Parag: which we utter in the world—and say Amen.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 5_Paragr: And how can we justify ourselves?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 6_Paragr: Let us search into our ways and examine them,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 8_Paragr: for Your right hand is extended
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 10_Parag: Not with virtue nor with good deeds
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 12_Parag: but like the poor and needy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 14_Parag: At Your door, do we knock,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 16_Parag: Please do not turn us away empty-handed
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 22_Parag: unto You does all flesh come.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 24_Parag: to prostrate themselves before You, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 25_Parag: They will come and prostrate themselves
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 27_Parag: and they will give honor to Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 28_Parag: Come let us prostrate ourselves and bow;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 29_Parag: let us kneel before Adonoy, our Maker.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 32_Parag: give thanks to Him, bless His Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 33_Parag: As for us, through Your abundant kindness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 36_Parag: toward Your Holy Sanctuary in awe of You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 39_Parag: who stand in the House of Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 41_Parag: Lift your hands to the Sanctuary
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 43_Parag: Let us come to His Dwelling Places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 44_Parag: let us prostrate ourselves at His footstool.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 46_Parag: and prostrate yourselves at His footstool,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 49_Parag: and prostrate yourselves at His holy mountain,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 50_Parag: for Adonoy our God is holy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 53_Parag: tremble before Him all [peoples of] the earth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 56_Parag: and give thanks to Your Name
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 57_Parag: for Your kindness and for Your truth;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 59_Parag: Your word far beyond Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 61_Parag: who is like You, a mighty God;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 62_Parag: and Your faithfulness is round about You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 65_Parag: who can be likened to Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 66_Parag: among the sons of the mighty?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 72_Parag: and until the skies is Your truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 73_Parag: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 75_Parag: For great is Adonoy and most highly extolled,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 76_Parag: and awesome is He above all gods.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 77_Parag: For a great Almighty is Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 78_Parag: and a great King over all gods.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 79_Parag: For who is so mighty in heaven or on earth
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 82_Parag: Who would not fear You, King of nations?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 83_Parag: For to You it is fitting;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 84_Parag: for among all the wise ones of the nations,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 87_Parag: There is none like You, Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 89_Parag: and great is Your Name in might.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 90_Parag: Yours is an arm with might
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 91_Parag: strong is Your hand, exalted is Your right hand.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 92_Parag: Yours is the day, also Yours is the night,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 94_Parag: For in His hands are the depths of the earth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 95_Parag: and the heights of the mountains are His.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 96_Parag: Who can recount the mighty deeds of Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 97_Parag: or cause to be heard all His praise?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 99_Parag: is the greatness, the might, the glory,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 101_Para: for all that is in heaven and on earth [is Yours];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 103_Para: and You are uplifted over all rulers.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 106_Para: the inhabited world and its fullness;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 108_Para: You set all the borders of the earth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 109_Para: summer and winter, You formed them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 110_Para: You crushed the heads of Leviathan,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 111_Para: You gave him as food to the people of legions.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 112_Para: You split open the fountain and brook,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 114_Para: You crumbled the sea with Your strength;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 115_Para: You shattered the heads of sea monsters
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 117_Para: You rule over the majesty of the sea;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 118_Para: when it raises its waves, You still them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 119_Para: Great is Adonoy and highly extolled
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 120_Para: in the city of our God,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 122_Para: Adonoy of Hosts, God of Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 126_Para: in the great council of the holy ones
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 128_Para: over all that are about Him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 129_Para: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 132_Para: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 133_Para: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 135_Para: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 136_Para: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 137_Para: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 138_Para: The Chazzan recites the following two sentences and the congregation repeats them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 140_Para: that understand the call of the teruah,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 142_Para: in the light of Your Presence they will walk.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 143_Para: With trumpets and the sound of the shofar
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 144_Para: raise your voice before the King, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 146_Para: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 147_Para: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 148_Para: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 150_Para: let us walk with the throngs.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 151_Para: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 152_Para: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 154_Para: is the soul of every living thing,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 155_Para: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 157_Para: and the body is Your doing,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 159_Para: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 161_Para: for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 162_Para: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 164_Para: for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 165_Para: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 168_Para: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 1_Chapter, 169_Para: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 0_Paragr: The following prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon ben Isaac (Rashi).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 2_Paragr: Who is feared by the heavenly angels,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 4_Paragr: come to Me with thanksgiving and praise,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 9_Paragr: the gates are open to the penitent—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 11_Parag: Your words stand firm for all time;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 18_Parag: we return to You with shameful faces,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 19_Parag: and at Your gates we moan like doves.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 20_Parag: Remember us for a [good] proper life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 22_Parag: that they be pure and white,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 23_Parag: erase the sins of our youth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 25_Parag: renew our days as the days of old.1Before we sinned.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 29_Parag: sprinkle upon us the faithful [pure] waters.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 31_Parag: we are rebellious and as evil as thorns,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 32_Parag: our necks are as stiff as oaks.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 35_Parag: it is covered with nettles and thorns [evil]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 40_Parag: the wedding-canopy2The giving of the Torah on Mount Sinai is compared to a wedding canopy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 41_Parag: since then we have been thrust backward
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 43_Parag: gone are the sacrifices of choice rams,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 45_Parag: Gone are the captain(s) of fifty,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 46_Parag: the advisor(s), the man (men) of honor,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 50_Parag: Behold! we stand impoverished and empty
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 51_Parag: grieved in spirit, bitter as wormwood.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 52_Parag: We remember You in our distress
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 58_Parag: Order the removal of our early iniquities.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 59_Parag: Let the voice [of our prayer] that calls,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 60_Parag: put an end to those who contend with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 66_Parag: as the fat of the sacrifice.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 67_Parag: The oath You swore to the Patriarchs—
