text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 71_Parag: prepare their hearts to fear You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 73_Parag: to the words of their supplication.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 79_Parag: let Your favored ones be found innocent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 84_Parag: and on Your righteousness, we rely,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 85_Parag: and for Your pardon, we hope,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 86_Parag: and for Your deliverance, we yearn.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 88_Parag: Who loves righteousness from of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 89_Parag: Who passes over the iniquities of His people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 90_Parag: and removes the sins of those who fear Him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 91_Parag: You made a covenant with the Patriarchs,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 95_Parag: in the cloud of Your glory, on Mount Sinai,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 96_Parag: and disclosed the ways of Your goodness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 100_Para: and You made known to him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 101_Para: that You are Almighty, Merciful, Gracious,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 102_Para: Slow to anger, Abounding in kindness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 110_Para: and I will proclaim the Name, Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 113_Para: to whom I will be gracious,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 115_Para: to whom I will be compassionate.’”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 116_Para: You are Almighty, Slow to Anger,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 117_Para: Lord of Mercy, You are called,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 118_Para: and the way of repentance, You have taught us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 119_Para: The greatness of Your mercy and kindliness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 120_Para: remember this day and every day
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 121_Para: for the descendants of Your loved ones.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 123_Para: for You are the Lord of Mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 127_Para: to [Moses,] the modest one of old.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 129_Para: as it is written in Your Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 130_Para: In the shadow of Your wings,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 131_Para: may we be sheltered and lodged,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 132_Para: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 136_Para: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 140_Para: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 149_Para: and Abundant in Kindness and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 154_Para: And Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 155_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 156_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 157_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 158_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 162_Para: to all who call upon You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 163_Para: Do not enter into judgment with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 164_Para: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 165_Para: Seek Adonoy when He is accessible,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 166_Para: call Him when He is near.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 167_Para: Adonoy is near to all who call upon Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 168_Para: to all who call upon Him in truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 169_Para: Adonoy is close to the broken-hearted,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 170_Para: and those crushed in spirit, He delivers.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 171_Para: For what nation is there so great
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 172_Para: that has God so near unto them,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 174_Para: in all that we call upon Him?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 175_Para: For Your sake, our God, act!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 177_Para: See how we stand impoverished and empty.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 178_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 179_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 181_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 182_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 183_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 185_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 187_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 189_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 192_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 193_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 197_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 198_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 199_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 200_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 201_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 202_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 203_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 204_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 205_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 2_Chapter, 209_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 2_Paragr: How can I open my mouth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 3_Paragr: and how can I lift my eyes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 4_Paragr: when in me there are no good deeds
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 5_Paragr: and in my hand there is no merit?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 6_Paragr: I shout, I am like a drunkard,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 7_Paragr: and like one overcome with wine.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 12_Parag: appointed to intercede on our behalf;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 13_Parag: and who is left to open his mouth—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 14_Parag: the fool, and one who lacks perception.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 15_Parag: His transgression is concealed in him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 16_Parag: and his iniquity is imprisoned within him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 17_Parag: he is a sinner and full of rebelliousness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 18_Parag: a captive of the despicable [evil inclination].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 19_Parag: Filled with distraction is this humiliated heart
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 20_Parag: of him who comes to entreat You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 21_Parag: the straight path he has distorted,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 23_Parag: [for] he has become twisted and crooked.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 24_Parag: His knee is weak because of his guilt,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 25_Parag: and the filth of his sin is his obstacle;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 26_Parag: in his heart he thinks of iniquity,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 27_Parag: and his deeds cause him to stumble.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 30_Parag: I have become repulsive and polluted
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 31_Parag: for I am filled with disgrace and derision.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 32_Parag: The abundance of my tears has not endured,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 35_Parag: is filled with iniquity and deceit,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 36_Parag: and my fast days filled with strife.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 37_Parag: Erase our transgression, forgive our iniquity,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 39_Parag: I cry out from an aching heart,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 40_Parag: that is disgraced, shamed and humiliated:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 43_Parag: be pleased with [our emmissary who seeks3A reference to the Chazzan.]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 44_Parag: to make us favored and loved [in Your eyes],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 45_Parag: and confound [Satan] who digs pits for us.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 53_Parag: He will not shame or detest
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 54_Parag: the cry of the humble and crushed [heart].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 55_Parag: A day of deliverance and a time of favor
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 56_Parag: may I find in Your Presence;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 58_Parag: may I be considered in Your eyes.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 60_Parag: to plead for mercy on Your children,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 61_Parag: let us hear, “I have bestowed favor on you,”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 63_Parag: may this be told us from Your Dwelling.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 64_Parag: Quickly, seek the Presence of the Almighty,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 65_Parag: excise the hardness of your hearts,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 67_Parag: clear the way and straighten the crooked,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 69_Parag: and do not continue to harden [your hearts].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 70_Parag: He who knows of his sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 71_Parag: let him repent and show regret,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 72_Parag: let him accept words of admonition,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 74_Parag: Listen O Master to my supplication,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 79_Parag: I call You out of distress,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 80_Parag: be near to me and come deliver me,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 81_Parag: quickly, help me, my Master, my deliverer.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 83_Parag: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 85_Parag: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 86_Parag: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 90_Parag: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 97_Parag: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 99_Parag: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 110_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 115_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 116_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 117_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 118_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 119_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 123_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 124_Para: Do not enter into judgement with us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 125_Para: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 126_Para: When You appoint a time, O God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 128_Para: Hear the voice of our supplications
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 129_Para: when we cry out to You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 131_Para: toward the Holy of Holies of Your Sanctuary.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 134_Para: And You Adonoy, are our shield,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 135_Para: our glory and the uplifter of our heads.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 136_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 137_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 139_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 140_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 141_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 143_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 145_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 146_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 149_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 150_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 153_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 154_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 155_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 156_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 157_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 158_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 159_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 160_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 161_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 3_Chapter, 165_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 0_Paragr: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Joseph ben Isaac of Orleans (1150).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 2_Paragr: Master! when You appoint a time
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 3_Paragr: to judge us rightly with Your might,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 5_Paragr: to see Your Presence, to exalt You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 6_Paragr: for I do not depend on my deeds,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 8_Paragr: Adonoy! Do it for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 9_Paragr: The faithful ones have been cut off—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 10_Parag: the mighty, with power to intercede,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 11_Parag: [gone] also are those who made fences
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 12_Parag: and stood in the breach4Defending the integrity of Yiddishkeit.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 14_Parag: before Him Who dwells in the high heavens.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 15_Parag: The pious man has perished from the earth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 17_Parag: and what can I answer with my mouth?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 19_Parag: without good deeds in my hand;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 21_Parag: when I am so full of fault?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 22_Parag: Let the words of my mouth be acceptable.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 23_Parag: I tremble and I am afraid
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 27_Parag: Gracious One, have mercy on me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 28_Parag: as I confess my sins and forsake them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 29_Parag: Hear the voice of my supplication,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 30_Parag: when I cry out to You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 32_Parag: but behold I repent and confess
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 34_Parag: You Who are pure of eyes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 35_Parag: consider me as perfect in Your Presence;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 37_Parag: more leniently than to the letter of Your law.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 39_Parag: [so] that I might find favor in Your eyes.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 41_Parag: and be adorned with my prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 42_Parag: as with the prayer of a [wise] old man,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 45_Parag: My heart is crushed, humbled and grieved.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 46_Parag: Look from the heavens and behold.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 48_Parag: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 50_Parag: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 51_Parag: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 55_Parag: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 62_Parag: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 64_Parag: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 75_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 80_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 81_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 82_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 83_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 84_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 4_Chapter, 88_Parag: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 0_Paragr: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Joseph ben Isaac of Orleans (1150).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Our God and god of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 2_Paragr: The needs of Your people are numerous,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 8_Paragr: The Almighty, Great, Powerful and Awesome.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 13_Parag: we are left bare and evil has increased,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 14_Parag: therefore we have not attained deliverance.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 19_Parag: Your charitable benevolence is all we ask
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 20_Parag: as we set forth Your praise,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 21_Parag: we who stand in the House of God, nightly.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 23_Parag: how the capable advocate is extinct,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 25_Parag: as if it were a generous offering;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 30_Parag: and may my prayer be pleasant [before You],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 31_Parag: hear my prayer as if it were perfect,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 32_Parag: decree for us a good life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 35_Parag: You suspend the earth on nothingness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 37_Parag: and accept my repentance as I stand,5Before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 38_Parag: please pardon and forgive my evil deeds.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 40_Parag: with the welfare of those who seek You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 42_Parag: for You, Adonoy, are a shield about me.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 43_Parag: Do not despise my words of praise,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 46_Parag: fulfill for good my desire and my request
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 47_Parag: God, my Master, is my strength.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 48_Parag: Let my words be pleasant [before You]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 49_Parag: and be receptive to my prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 52_Parag: Holy One, regard my standing [in prayer]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 53_Parag: as a meal-offering mixed with oil.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 54_Parag: Give ear, God of Jacob, forever.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 56_Parag: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 58_Parag: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 59_Parag: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 63_Parag: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 70_Parag: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 72_Parag: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 83_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 88_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 89_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 90_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 91_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 92_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 96_Parag: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 97_Parag: Do not enter into judgement with us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 98_Parag: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 99_Parag: Give ear, Adonoy, to our prayer
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 100_Para: listen to the voice of our supplication.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 101_Para: What can we say before You, Adonoy, our God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 103_Para: and how can we justify ourselves?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 104_Para: We have sinned, as have our fathers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 105_Para: we have caused others to sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 106_Para: and we have caused others to do evil.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 107_Para: The sins and transgressions of our youth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 112_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 113_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 115_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 116_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 117_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 119_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 121_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 122_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 125_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 126_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 129_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 130_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 131_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 132_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 133_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 134_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 135_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 136_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 137_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 5_Chapter, 141_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragr: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon Ibn Gabirol (1021–1056).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragr: We beseech You, arouse Your old love,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 5_Paragr: with every term of love, brotherhood
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragr: for the sake of my brethren and companions,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 8_Paragr: let me speak, I beseech You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragr: When You set foot on Mount [Sinai]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 10_Parag: to delight us with Your ancient treasure,6The Torah which existed even before Creation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 11_Parag: You likened us to a kingdom of priests
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 12_Parag: and a holy nation, [calling us] “My son”;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 14_Parag: “He is my brother, my King, and my Master.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 16_Parag: a delightful heritage, the sweet portion;7The Land of Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 17_Parag: Your glory [Shechinah] You caused to frequent
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 18_Parag: between the images of the Cherubim;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 19_Parag: and now they [Israel] have been driven away
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 21_Parag: In a land that is not theirs,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 24_Parag: be not silent and do not rest, Almighty,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 25_Parag: for Edom and Ishmael wanted to cut me off,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 29_Parag: Plunderers beset me and emptied me,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 30_Parag: to exchange the clean for the unclean,8To renounce Judaism.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 33_Parag: how Your servants are beaten and whipped;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 34_Parag: the voice of Your brother’s blood cries out.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 35_Parag: They have dug a pit to trap me;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 38_Parag: knock at my door and be my deliverance,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 40_Parag: From the Day of Rosh Hashana9See Metsudah T’hillim page 165 note 4.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 41_Parag: when You sit on Your glorious throne
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 42_Parag: and look down to examine simultaneously
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 43_Parag: the hearts of those who rebel against You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 44_Parag: and the hearts of those who serve You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 46_Parag: the debt from all who rebel against You;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 47_Parag: but whatever Your brother owes You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 49_Parag: When the Books [of Life and Death] are read
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 50_Parag: for the creatures of Your world,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 51_Parag: decreeing life or the opposite [of life]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 52_Parag: to the rich and the poor;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 53_Parag: Most High grant favor and kindness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 55_Parag: Be surety for Your servant for good,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 56_Parag: so that Your brother may live with You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 57_Parag: Turn to me and be gracious to me,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 59_Parag: cause those who provoke You to perish
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 61_Parag: but when You apportion the sustenance
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 66_Parag: and cry to You my Creator.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 68_Parag: and forgive my transgression and treachery.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 69_Parag: Let Your mercy be extended to me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 70_Parag: as one who comforts me in my mourning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 71_Parag: O that You were like a brother to me.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 72_Parag: Consider the supplication of Your poor ones
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 74_Parag: satiated with troubles are their souls and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 75_Parag: cast into the depths of the sea
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 80_Parag: I rejoice at the word of Your promise,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 83_Parag: when will You reveal Your mighty arm?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 85_Parag: to the peace [welfare] of Your brothers.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 86_Parag: You were always the hope of Israel
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 87_Parag: and the sword of their pride,10Israel took pride that God fought their battles.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 88_Parag: living God, lift up their stature now,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 89_Parag: strengthen their arm and dwell among them;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 90_Parag: and Your brothers, remember them for peace
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 93_Parag: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 95_Parag: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 96_Parag: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 100_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 107_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 109_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 120_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 125_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 126_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 127_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 128_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 129_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 133_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 134_Para: Do not enter into judgement with us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 135_Para: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 136_Para: Give ear Adonoy to our prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 137_Para: listen to the voice of our supplication.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 138_Para: What can we say before You Adonoy our God?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 140_Para: And how can we justify ourselves?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 141_Para: Our God, we are ashamed and embarrassed
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 142_Para: to lift up our faces to You, our God,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 145_Para: We have sinned together with our fathers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 146_Para: we have been malicious and have done evil.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 147_Para: The sins of our youth, and our transgressions,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 149_Para: According to Your kindness, remember us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 150_Para: for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 151_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 152_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 154_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 155_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 156_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 158_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 160_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 161_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 164_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 165_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 168_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 169_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 170_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 171_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 172_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 173_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 174_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 175_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 176_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 6_Chapter, 180_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 0_Paragr: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Joel ben Isaac HaLevi.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 2_Paragr: My eye pours out tears to God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 3_Paragr: when I cry to You, say, “I am here;”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 4_Paragr: give ear to my words when I pray,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 6_Paragr: When You weigh my actions on the scale,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 7_Paragr: [You will see] that in Your commandments,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 8_Paragr: my share and desire is insignificant,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 9_Paragr: and if You reward me according to my work
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 10_Parag: I am afraid, for I am bare [of good deeds].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 11_Parag: Banish and consume, sin and rebellion
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 12_Parag: uncover the flask of healing, [heal my soul]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 16_Parag: when You come to decide my recompense.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 19_Parag: Consider that their origin is dust,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 20_Parag: repay them not according to their deeds
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 21_Parag: for great is the wickedness of man.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 22_Parag: The sinful soul, how can it be atoned?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 23_Parag: Riches are of no avail, nor great ransom
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 24_Parag: for You have set as witness [Satan]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 26_Parag: to our sins, committed inside and outside.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 29_Parag: his perverse deeds and all his activities,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 32_Parag: When the plague is engraved on the wall.11When his sins are obvious.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 35_Parag: who are alert to guard you
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 37_Parag: even [the soul] that lies within man
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 38_Parag: testifies against rich and poor alike
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 39_Parag: when it stands before the King.12Each evening the soul returns to Heaven and reports man’s activities.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 40_Parag: I tremble, for nothing is hidden from Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 41_Parag: Who relates to man his every word,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 42_Parag: and even his thoughts as he lies on his bed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 43_Parag: He must give an accounting to His Creator.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 47_Parag: because you will not be saved
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 48_Parag: by all the wealth you leave behind,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 49_Parag: when the Ruler says, “Come, give account.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 50_Parag: You appointed four periods13See Mesechet Rosh Hashana 16a. and set them
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 51_Parag: to judge the remnant of Your inheritance,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 52_Parag: and if they have trespassed against You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 54_Parag: and do not stand in the crossway
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 56_Parag: For on the day of Rosh Hashana14See Metsudah T’hillim page 165 note 4.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 59_Parag: be he poor or rich, he is judged,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 60_Parag: some go up and some go down.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 61_Parag: Appoint a just advocate for Your people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 63_Parag: to be counted with Your rod,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 64_Parag: like a flock of sheep passing by
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 65_Parag: the hand of one who counts them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 66_Parag: Let Your people’s judgement be first.15Before the Almighty is angered by the other nations.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 69_Parag: and judge each nation by itself,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 70_Parag: let there not be an inter-mixture.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 72_Parag: who can be associated with You?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 74_Parag: no one uses a broken vessel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 77_Parag: is anything too miraculous for Adonoy?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 78_Parag: Clear away the stumbling block16The Evil Inclination.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 79_Parag: that the path may become smooth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 81_Parag: call out to the concealed fool,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 82_Parag: for the enemy cares not of our hurt;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 83_Parag: come let us deal wisely with him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 86_Parag: during the years of his life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 87_Parag: doing the will of his Creator
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 89_Parag: but well for him who clings to his Creator
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 91_Parag: then he is a servant free from his master.17The Evil Inclination.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 92_Parag: He who prepares his meal before evening,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 94_Parag: will be prepared for the future [world];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 95_Parag: but he who waits for the Sabbath,18When death approaches.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 96_Parag: what gain will he have?19This is a paraphrase of the saying, “He who prepares before the Sabbath, will have what to eat on the Sabbath.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 98_Parag: cannot be made straight.20Koheles 1:15.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 99_Parag: Therefore, we hasten to pray even before
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 100_Para: the Day of Judgement, listen to our prayer;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 106_Para: for no opportunity will be given him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 108_Para: Rise you who sleep in the cave of Machpelah,21The Patriarchs.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 110_Para: I am disgraced, and I have no good deeds,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 111_Para: cry out and pray to God, with me,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 112_Para: and from the strength [of your deeds]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 113_Para: offer a gratuity on my behalf.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 115_Para: to strengthen those that are powerless,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 117_Para: for they were forgotten these many years,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 120_Para: who come weeping and supplicating [to You].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 121_Para: Almighty One, because of our rebellion,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 123_Para: but now that we return to You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 124_Para: have mercy on us as a father on his sons;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 125_Para: remember that You called us children,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 126_Para: and You are the one Father of us all,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 127_Para: why diminish the Name of our Father?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 128_Para: I have no offering to present to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 129_Para: in exchange accept my prayer and plea,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 132_Para: and let all these people know
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 135_Para: repentance even before creation,22God knew that the world could not exist without repentance.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 136_Para: God considered it a benefit [to man],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 137_Para: and so we hasten to return to You;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 138_Para: cause us to return to You Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 141_Para: they beseech You with great murmuring,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 142_Para: let their voice be heard in His Dwelling,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 145_Para: in the merit of the three Patriarchs,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 146_Para: may Almighty God grant you mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 148_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 150_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 151_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 155_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 162_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 164_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 175_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 180_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 181_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 182_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 183_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 184_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 188_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 189_Para: The Rock, His work is perfect,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 190_Para: for all His ways are justice.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 193_Para: For Your judgement they stand today,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 194_Para: for they are all Your servants.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 195_Para: Blow the shofar on the new month,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 196_Para: at the appointed time for our festive day.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 197_Para: For it is a statute for Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 198_Para: a day of judgement of the God of Jacob.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 201_Para: Your judgements like the great deep;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 202_Para: man and beast, You deliver, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 203_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 204_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 206_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 207_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 208_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 210_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 212_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 213_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 216_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 217_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 220_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 221_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 222_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 223_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 224_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 225_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 226_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 227_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 228_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 7_Chapter, 232_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 3_Paragr: and do goodness to Your entire nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 4_Paragr: [when] they come together to be judged.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 6_Paragr: [and] rules the world with His might
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 7_Paragr: brings to judgment for everything hidden.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 8_Paragr: God, Who is exalted through judgment1I.e. by bringing the evil to justice, all perceive Him ruling the world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 12_Parag: Remove retribution from those You carry,2“Those You carry,” i.e. the nation of Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 13_Parag: those who exalt You with “Grace and truth.”3I.e. those who recognize God’s grace and truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 15_Parag: are the foundations of Your Throne.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 16_Parag: Straighten before You, a crooked heart,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 17_Parag: Your judgment bores through the mountain4I.e. nothing can stand in the way of God’s judgment.—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 18_Parag: the justice of the God of Jacob.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 22_Parag: as they stand to be judged by You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 23_Parag: Your seal [of justice] is pure and clean,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 24_Parag: according to man’s acts [his fate] is sealed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 25_Parag: [Thus], the judgments of God are true.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 27_Parag: Who grinds and pulverizes finely.5I.e. who investigates to the minutest detail.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 28_Parag: The judgments of God are true and just.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 29_Parag: He is a good supporter as He promised,6I.e. He is good to us even when punishing us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 30_Parag: on this day7I.e. on the judgment day. He will forget His wrath
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 32_Parag: Those clinging to You pour [their hearts] out in prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 33_Parag: and praise You for Your perfect laws
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 37_Parag: those who look to You in hope
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 38_Parag: and do justice for them.8“Do … them” i.e. avenge them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 39_Parag: We were established to remember Your Name
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 40_Parag: we were placed for an everlasting covenant.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 41_Parag: [Thus] do not come into judgment with us.9I.e. do not judge us harshly.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 42_Parag: The One Who rules the angels!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 43_Parag: May He close the breach with compassion
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 44_Parag: and through judgment establish the Land.10I.e. may He rebuild our land by first avenging us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 45_Parag: My songs praise Him the entire day
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 46_Parag: for we do not find Him burdening us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 47_Parag: [For it is God’s (way) to be just].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 48_Parag: Strengthen Your nation with Your kindness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 49_Parag: to their cries open Your heavens
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 50_Parag: as befits those who love Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 51_Parag: We will throw all our burdens upon You.11I.e.—we will trust in You to care for all our problems.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 52_Parag: Tip the scales with love12I.e. out of Your love for us let our merits outweigh our discretions.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 54_Parag: Shine Your countenance to forgive me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 56_Parag: do not extinguish my ember13Do not have me die.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 57_Parag: for to Your justice do I look forward.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 58_Parag: Find us righteous as one being,14Consider us as one with the rest of the Jewish nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 59_Parag: keep us from the blaze of the coming day15“Coming day”—i.e. the day of Judgment.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 61_Parag: Bring Your tribes closer to salvation,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 62_Parag: who are tied to the ropes of Your chastisement
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 63_Parag: and the righteousness of Your judgment.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 64_Parag: Song from the heart of flesh and soul
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 65_Parag: shall rise to You to the heavens,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 66_Parag: the place of judgment is there.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 67_Parag: Our Judge, Who formed us with Your hands,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 68_Parag: teach Your ways to those who look to You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 69_Parag: as well as all the Laws that you commanded.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 71_Parag: Your powerful mercy according to our will.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 72_Parag: As is Your manner, grant us life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 73_Parag: The Temple [has become] stones of the field.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 75_Parag: Zion will be redeemed through justice.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 79_Parag: of those who have scattered me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 83_Parag: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 85_Parag: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 86_Parag: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 90_Parag: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 97_Parag: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 99_Parag: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 110_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 115_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 116_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 117_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 118_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 119_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 123_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 124_Para: Do not enter into judgment with us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 125_Para: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 126_Para: God is our hope and strength,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 127_Para: our help in trouble, He is most accessible.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 128_Para: May God favor us and bless us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 129_Para: may He cause His countenance to shine
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 132_Para: this one He humbles and this one He exalts.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 133_Para: God, deliver us with Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 134_Para: and with Your might, judge us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 136_Para: give ear to the words of our mouth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 138_Para: cause us to return to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 141_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 142_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 144_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 145_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 146_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 148_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 150_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 151_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 154_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 155_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 158_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 159_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 160_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 161_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 162_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 163_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 164_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 165_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 166_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 8_Chapter, 170_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 0_Paragr: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Yoel ben Yitzchak HaLevi.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 1_Paragr: God! Let Him choose for Himself
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 2_Paragr: the scattered sheep1Israel, which is scattered among nations as sheep among the wolves.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 4_Paragr: To the sound of her cries
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 5_Paragr: let Him listen and be attentive,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 7_Paragr: by the sword and arrow.2Of the nations.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 9_Paragr: the evil one to blaspheme God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 10_Parag: God! I tremble at the uproar,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 11_Parag: the tumultous clamor3Of our enemies.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 12_Parag: urging me to refute Your Oneness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 15_Parag: to remove me from my belief in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 16_Parag: so that the vile one can say in his heart
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 22_Parag: Why do You ignore without hearing
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 23_Parag: that he has villified the armies of God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 24_Parag: God! be our Protector and we shall sing
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 25_Parag: at the demise of the evil ones
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 26_Parag: who say: “Do not partake of Your Torah,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 28_Parag: that you chose the honored God;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 29_Parag: it is in vain to worship God.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 31_Parag: to tire and exhaust Your inheritance,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 33_Parag: they have made their sign as a sign.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 34_Parag: See that they have cut off the sheep
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 40_Parag: that they4The nations. have decided to slaughter
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 42_Parag: who have volunteered for the sword,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 47_Parag: and avenge me from the hands of Esau
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 50_Parag: for You have given up on me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 51_Parag: and that I have been forgotten by God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 52_Parag: They5Israel. rejected any new god
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 55_Parag: and spat at their books of philosophy;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 57_Parag: his spirit and body6To sanctify God’s holy Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 59_Parag: for they were7Lit. “he was.” taken by God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 61_Parag: and confessed [the sins] of their souls,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 63_Parag: To their mothers they cried out:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 64_Parag: “Hurry and bind us,8So that we will not resist.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 65_Parag: for through us God will be honored.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 66_Parag: Let God fight for him9I.e. the nation of Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 67_Parag: just as He gave over His people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 70_Parag: May she be10I.e. the soul of His nation. bound
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 71_Parag: to those who sit in a circle11I.e. the Sanhedrin who customarily sit in a semi-circle.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 72_Parag: [in the garden of Eden] of God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 73_Parag: God! To those who are pure of heart
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 74_Parag: my eyes flow [with tears like] water
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 75_Parag: when I remember that with their feet
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 76_Parag: they dragged them along the roads.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 77_Parag: Hear the voice of those who blaspheme,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 79_Parag: enough of their sounds, O God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 80_Parag: God! Accept me! And be a strength
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 81_Parag: to those who come under Your wing
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 82_Parag: to find protection from the beasts.12לבְאָיִם—lit. lions.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 83_Parag: They have run for Your help
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 84_Parag: to be saved from conspiracy13Of the nations.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 86_Parag: God! May they fall in their conspiracies,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 89_Parag: and lay Your anger upon them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 91_Parag: [receive] their just rewards upon their heads
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 92_Parag: and let all nations be erased
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 95_Parag: May we please fall into Your hands,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 96_Parag: but into the hands of the evil
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 98_Parag: Seek the vengeance of the persecuted
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 99_Parag: the children of Your beloved ones.14I.e. Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 100_Para: How dear is Your kindness, O God!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 106_Para: from those who rise up [against me].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 108_Para: God! Let the voice of my speech
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 111_Para: from the ends of the world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 115_Para: at a time of acceptance to You, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 118_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 120_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 121_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 125_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 132_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 134_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 145_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 150_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 151_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 152_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 153_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 154_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 158_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 159_Para: Do not enter into judgment with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 160_Para: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 161_Para: Adonoy knows the thoughts of man
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 165_Para: the prayers of Your people, Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 166_Para: Pardon Your people who sinned to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 171_Para: as You have sworn to our fathers
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 176_Para: and Abounding in kindness and truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 177_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 178_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 180_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 181_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 182_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 184_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 186_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 187_Para: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 190_Para: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 191_Para: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 194_Para: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 195_Para: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 196_Para: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 197_Para: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 198_Para: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 199_Para: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 200_Para: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 201_Para: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 202_Para: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 9_Chapter, 206_Para: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 1_Parag: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 2_Parag: It is true that You are first
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 3_Parag: and there is no genesis to Your beginning1There is no beginning for God since He has always existed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 5_Parag: and there is no end to Your lasting.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 7_Parag: that there is none besides You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 11_Para: is alluded to [in the words]: “בׇרׇא אֳלׂהִים אֵת“ “God created the’’2Genesis I 1; the letters ending בׇּרׇא אֳלׂקִים אֵת make up the word אֶמֶת (truth).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 12_Para: in [the Torah which is] Your beauty
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 16_Para: Therefore, God, we shall praise You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 17_Para: by arranging songs of Your praise.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 18_Para: The beginning of Your Word is Truth.3I.e. the beginning of the Torah make up the word אֶמֶת. V. note 2.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 22_Para: they are signed and outlined.4[The word] … outlined: The word אמת is alluded to six times from the first word in the Torah until “la’asos” (Genesis II, 3).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 24_Para: are expressed in the ending of words5In Genesis I, 1:ברא אלקים את end in אֶמֶת; in I, 4 “וירא אלקים את“ end in אֶמֶת. So, too, I, 28: I, 27; I, 31, II, 3.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 25_Para: they6I.e. the mitzvos of the Torah. are strongly supported forever
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 26_Para: for they were founded in Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 29_Para: one from another at length7I.e. the “א“ is at the beginning of the “aleph-beth,” the “מ“ is in the middle and the “ת“ at the end.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 31_Para: are close together,8ש,ק,ר are one next to another in the “aleph-beth.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 32_Para: and it has no leg to stand on.9I.e. falsehood cannot be everlasting.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 34_Para: Who looks down from the heavenly aperture;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 35_Para: Who leads me in the true way.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 36_Para: Truth (the Torah) was in His Mouth
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 37_Para: when He created His world10The Midrash states that God used the Torah as a blueprint for creating the world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 38_Para: a delight He holds upon His lap
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 39_Para: to cleave together.11The Torah being the wisdom of God is looked upon as one with God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 41_Para: are based upon its (the Torah’s) advice.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 42_Para: All God’s ways are goodness and truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 45_Para: merit their reward [in the world to come].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 46_Para: The One Who acts with justice
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 48_Para: will not stay aloof from them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 51_Para: his mouth will be stopped up.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 52_Para: But, the one who plants righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 53_Para: will receive true and lasting reward.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 56_Para: Israel that is saved by Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 59_Para: in the shadow of Him Who rests on high,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 60_Para: and serve Him with perfection and truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 63_Para: and You said [to us]: “Improve your ways.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 65_Para: shall you judge within your gates.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 68_Para: will your true words become apparent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 69_Para: He arranged “אֶמֶת“ to be His seal
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 70_Para: to make it known that He is One
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 71_Para: and there is no other.12“He arranged — other.” There is nothing that can stand in the way of His fulfilling His promises; hence His seal of “truth.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 72_Para: This is my God and I will glorify Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 73_Para: the God of my father and I will exalt Him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 74_Para: Adonoy is close to all who call to Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 75_Para: to all who truly call to Him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 76_Para: My mouth will utter [words of] Truth13I.e. the Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 77_Para: and I will speak of Your Law.13I.e. the Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 78_Para: I will recall my song [of praise] at night
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 79_Para: and that I cleaved to Your Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 80_Para: God! Remember this for the good
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 81_Para: of all the members of Your covenant.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 83_Para: and all Your precepts are true.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 84_Para: My flesh truly yearns for You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 86_Para: [I pray] that You save Your servants
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 88_Para: and take pity on all the children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 89_Para: of the one who left “Kasdim.”14I.e. Abraham who originated from Ur Kasdim.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 91_Para: are the fundamentals of Your Throne
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 94_Para: but evil, only for the moment.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 95_Para: [You, therefore, commanded:] in the morning15Do not procrastinate to pass judgment. judge your judgments,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 98_Para: [you] My priests and elders,16Who sit in judgment.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 99_Para: for the Laws of Adonoy are true.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 100_Par: Let truth sprout from the land
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 101_Par: and let justice prevail from on high.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 102_Par: As far as east is from west
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 103_Par: remove iniquities,17I.e. let evil be as far from us as possible.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 104_Par: though the righteous one is no more,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 105_Par: the one who acts with forebearance,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 106_Par: who acts justly and acts righteously
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 107_Par: and speaks truthfully.18“Though the righteous—truthfully” i.e. remove our iniquities despite that we no longer have amongst us the righteous in whose merit we would deserve this.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 111_Par: will not withstand the appointed day.19“Appointed day” i.e. day of judgment.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 112_Par: He should tremble from the judgment day.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 116_Par: that You will not put to shame
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 118_Par: You desire kindness rather than sacrifices
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 119_Par: as You have spoken [in the Prophets].20V. Hoshea 6, 7.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 121_Par: of those who worship a buried god.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 122_Par: Do not keep from me the word of truth.21The Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 126_Par: and the shame [that comes with sin].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 127_Par: Turn to those who seek You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 128_Par: You, Who preserves kindness,22Based on נוׄצֵר חֶסֶד לָאֲלָפִים (Exodus 34, 7) God preserves and rewards kindness for thousands of generations thereafter.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 130_Par: and is abundantly kind and trustworthy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 131_Par: Angels of truth23“פְּלִיאִים“ lit. hidden, i.e., their names are unknown.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 132_Par: pray for us before Adonoy of Hosts.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 133_Par: Michael and Gabriel, bring a gift (our prayers)
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 134_Par: to Adonoy by Whom you are awed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 135_Par: And please beseech the countenance of God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 136_Par: to bring closer the end which is hidden24The days of the Messiah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 137_Par: and give to me a truthful sign [that your prayers were accepted].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 139_Par: the nation that has been weakened,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 140_Par: but the kindness of nations is sinful,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 141_Par: the nations that regret [their good deeds],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 142_Par: that declare wood and stone to be gods.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 143_Par: And only Adonoy, God is true.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 144_Par: Buy truthfulness25Based on Avos Chap. I, Mishnah 6.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 145_Par: and do not sell it.26Teach others without pay.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 146_Par: [Do this] in order to serve and worship
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 147_Par: to uplift the Name of Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 148_Par: for His Name alone is exalted,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 149_Par: for He satiates every living thing
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 151_Par: [He does this] with an open hand.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 156_Par: for Your judgment is deep as the abyss
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 157_Par: and Your justice as the highest mountains.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 158_Par: Accept the prayer of the nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 159_Par: that turns to You with its requests:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 160_Par: “In your hands do I place my soul
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 167_Par: Who establishes the world with justice
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 171_Par: according to the truth of things.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 173_Par: and the kindness to the children of Abraham,27“אַב הַמוׄנִי“ Abraham is called “אַב הַמוׄן גוׄיִם“ (Gen. 17, 5) “a father of a multitude of nations.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 174_Par: for as a result of Your love for us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 177_Par: that are red as the red thread.28The red thread that was tied to the goat that was sent to Azazel on Yom Kippur which miraculously turned white as a sign that our sins were forgiven (v. Lev. chap. 16).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 178_Par: Let my prayer to You, Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 183_Par: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 185_Par: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 186_Par: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 190_Par: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 197_Par: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 199_Par: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 210_Par: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 215_Par: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 216_Par: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 217_Par: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 218_Par: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 219_Par: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 223_Par: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 224_Par: Do not enter into judgment with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 225_Par: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 227_Par: in order that You be feared.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 228_Par: For with You is the source of life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 229_Par: [and] in Your light shall we see light.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 230_Par: [Grant us] life, and do kindness with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 231_Par: and let Your precepts preserve our spirit.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 235_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 236_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 238_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 239_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 240_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 242_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 244_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 245_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 248_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 249_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 252_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 253_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 254_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 255_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 256_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 257_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 258_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 259_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 260_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 10_Chapter, 264_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 1_Parag: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 3_Parag: and let us not be uprooted.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 4_Parag: As You sit upon Your throne
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 5_Parag: examining all actions in Your judgment,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 7_Parag: and do not examine the evil;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 8_Parag: for with You is the source of life.1You dispense life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 9_Parag: You dispense life when You are willing
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 10_Para: while Your period of anger is fleeting.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 13_Para: Let me hear the clarion, “I forgive!”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 14_Para: as You forgive my sins, and
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 15_Para: [also let me hear] “I’ve granted you today
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 17_Para: Grant us life and redeem us from ruin.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 18_Para: Wrap me with the kindness of Abraham2Abraham, the patriarch, is sometimes referred to as “Ezrach,” e.g. Ayson Haezrachi.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 19_Para: and with the truth that was rooted in Jacob,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 20_Para: he planted it and it flourished [in Israel].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 22_Para: as west is distant from east.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 23_Para: Make known to us the truth path of life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 24_Para: Make known to us Your living Word3The Torah gives life to those who uphold it.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 26_Para: [motivate us] to cling to Your Torah;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 27_Para: His advice is for our own benefit.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 29_Para: over the evil inclination and shatter it
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 31_Para: the way of the Tree of Life.4The Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 32_Para: The Torah sustains those who hold it.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 33_Para: It is a cure and antidote for sickness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 34_Para: The supporters of Torah are also fortunate
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 35_Para: to bask in the expanding radiance of Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 36_Para: Those who cling to the way of Torah,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 37_Para: have an added quality to their lives
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 39_Para: Support us with life and peace
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 40_Para: that we may serve You in reverence.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 41_Para: We shall be glad and rejoice in You
