text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 43_Para: May the three hundred ten worlds5Which are reserved for the righteous.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 45_Para: and grant us the reverence of God [which leads]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 47_Para: He granted us a fortunate portion in life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 48_Para: He Who provides advice and thoughts,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 49_Para: He Who is a refuge to us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 50_Para: and a helper during times of travail.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 51_Para: “Return to me and I shall return to you,”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 52_Para: He says as He opens His mouth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 53_Para: “Because he who finds Me, discovers life.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 54_Para: Grant me the gift of undeserved life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 58_Para: and Your enemies will be cloaked in shame
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 59_Para: as You punish them in rebuke.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 60_Para: They will not repent or comprehend
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 62_Para: Bestow good life to Your servants.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 64_Para: just as You granted King David his request.6See Psalms 21, 5.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 67_Para: send the angel of death unto them
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 68_Para: in order that they descend to their graves.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 69_Para: Those of us who are alive can thank You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 70_Para: but not those who are severed from life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 72_Para: of Your praises in his conversation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 75_Para: that we may merit to see God’s goodness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 76_Para: upon us in the land of life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 77_Para: Let us hear today: “That you all will live”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 78_Para: with the proper allotment of sustenance.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 80_Para: and don’t turn them away empty-handed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 81_Para: Those decreed for death are in Your hands
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 83_Para: and even those destined for death
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 85_Para: grant them a portion amongst the living.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 86_Para: Life is an attribute for the discerning person
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 87_Para: because through the life of Torah he can
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 90_Para: redeem my soul from a broken body
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 93_Para: For the mitzvah is a lamp
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 95_Para: and the way to achieve life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 96_Para: Erase from the book of life
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 97_Para: Gival and Moav who are now exalted
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 98_Para: though they bow down to a block of wood
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 99_Para: and proclaim it to be a god.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 100_Par: Do not grant kindness to the wicked
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 102_Par: let them be sentenced for destruction
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 104_Par: who are the legions of the eternal God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 108_Par: was to be the inheritance of his descendants
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 109_Par: through You they would fall in his hands.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 111_Par: You will again grant us mercy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 113_Par: for Your kindness is greater than life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 114_Par: [Instruct us in the path of true life] in order that we be satiated with joy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 115_Par: when we see Your wondrous face.7A reference to the Divine Presence, (Shechinah).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 116_Par: Renew our days like in times of old
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 117_Par: and people will see our graciousness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 118_Par: Return and have mercy upon us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 122_Par: be decreed for Your people from the heavens
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 123_Par: and cast into the depths of the sea
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 124_Par: all of our sins and iniquities.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 125_Par: Create for us a pure heart
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 127_Par: of many days and years of life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 128_Par: Grant life to the righteous one
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 129_Par: and to the wicked dispense fear.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 130_Par: When on Rosh Hashana You decree wars,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 131_Par: or peace or fears and trembling,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 132_Par: a year of plenty or famine,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 134_Par: a year of blessing or curse,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 135_Par: choose for us the portion of life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 136_Par: A life of righteousness and dignity
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 137_Par: grant her8Israel. who is beautiful and amenable,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 138_Par: who does kindness with others, privately,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 140_Par: Adonoy make the righteous one secure
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 142_Par: He who pursues righteousness and kindness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 144_Par: Grant us the inheritance of eternal life (Torah)
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 145_Par: given with Divine wisdom and advice.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 146_Par: Let gladness and rejoicing be heard
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 149_Par: and garb us with fresh clothing (Torah).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 150_Par: I will then go before God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 151_Par: in the lands of life.8Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 152_Par: See fit, God, to grant life
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 153_Par: to Your people who are Your treasure,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 154_Par: let them return to serve you as previously.9In the days of the Holy Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 155_Par: You do not desire the death of the sinner
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 159_Par: Therefore say to them that they are holy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 160_Par: include them among those inscribed for life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 162_Par: You granted it to him.10When Moshiach Ben David sees that Moshiach Ben Yosef is killed he will ask God for life, and God will grant him that request because of King David’s prayer. See Succah 52.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 163_Par: Grant him life now as You did then.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 164_Par: His glory will be great in Your salvation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 165_Par: [just as the glory of Israel was great] as they ascended to Jerusalem at festivals.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 166_Par: Look from the dwelling place of Your holiness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 169_Par: spring water will flow from Jerusalem.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 173_Par: “And My spirit, I will place among you”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 174_Par: saying that I found atonement [for you].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 177_Par: to Adonoy, Your God, Who lives eternally.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 179_Par: support Your dove (Israel) who follows You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 184_Par: (and sends forth) the blessing of life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 187_Par: At this time Adonoy will expand our territory
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 188_Par: enabling us to increase and multiply.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 189_Par: From the destruction of the two temples
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 190_Par: He will resurrect us and build the third Temple,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 191_Par: and all those who are before You today
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 194_Par: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 196_Par: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 197_Par: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 201_Par: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 208_Par: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 210_Par: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 221_Par: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 226_Par: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 227_Par: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 228_Par: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 229_Par: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 230_Par: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 234_Par: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 235_Par: Do not enter into judgment with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 236_Par: for no living being will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 237_Par: And now our Master, the King,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 238_Par: the eyes of all Israel are on You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 239_Par: Adonoy is King, Adonoy was King,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 240_Par: Adonoy will be King forever and ever.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 241_Par: You are our King from of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 242_Par: You effect deliverances in the midst of the earth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 245_Par: And it will be on that day,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 251_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 252_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 254_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 255_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 256_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 258_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 260_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 261_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 264_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 265_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 268_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 269_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 270_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 271_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 272_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 273_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 274_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 275_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 276_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 11_Chapter, 280_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Joel ben Isaac Halevi.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 1_Parag: One King will rule [all] the nations,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 2_Parag: He [God] will raise my banner,1Of redemption.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 3_Parag: He will cause those appointed to tax me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 5_Parag: and my oppressors to deal righteously.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 6_Parag: I will make it known to him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 7_Parag: when I say, “Where is God Who made me?”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 8_Parag: I say, “My deeds are in honor of the King.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 9_Parag: The King will call to judgement
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 11_Para: therefore, I hasten to flee [from evil]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 12_Para: [and seek] the Presence of the Almighty.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 13_Para: I and my young men will fast,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 15_Para: and thus will I go into the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 16_Para: The King is greater than all gods,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 17_Para: He is the possessor of heaven and earth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 20_Para: Angels of mercy! Please entreat Him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 23_Para: who serve in the Presence of the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 26_Para: to repair the breaches of the house,2The House of Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 27_Para: to remove the stones from Your vineyard3Remove the sins, the stumbling blocks from Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 28_Para: and to erect a fence around it;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 29_Para: strengthen the advocate and silence the accuser,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 30_Para: so that he does no damage,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 32_Para: is not worthy of the King’s loss.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 33_Para: O King! see what is good in Your eyes—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 36_Para: let destruction and ruin come upon him;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 39_Para: let the evil decree against him be final
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 41_Para: The King and His command approaches
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 42_Para: on the day when judgment is recorded,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 44_Para: the righteous, the sinner and the guilty;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 45_Para: and now let the King’s scribes be called,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 46_Para: those who cause drought and make rain,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 47_Para: and let them inscribe for the Jews
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 48_Para: whatever You desire in the King’s Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 49_Para: O King! Put to shame the sun’s brilliance,4So that men will not worship it.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 50_Para: and let the worshippers of Nebo be disgraced,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 51_Para: let man despise his idols of silver
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 53_Para: for they will see with their eyes
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 55_Para: and be uplifted doors to eternity
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 56_Para: so that the King may enter.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 57_Para: The wise King Who scatters the wicked
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 59_Para: and turns the wheel upon them5He punishes them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 63_Para: that he not open his mouth [against us];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 64_Para: [and say to him]: “That he is forbidden
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 67_Para: let there go forth a royal edict from Him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 69_Para: “I will guard the feet of my children,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 70_Para: and will not put them in stockades6To torture them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 71_Para: on the day set for judging
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 72_Para: who shall prosper and who shall fail,”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 73_Para: for so has the King ordained.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 74_Para: The King sits on the throne of judgment,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 75_Para: small and great, He reviews as one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 76_Para: and discerns who is truly penitent
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 77_Para: and who returns like a dog;7He who returns to his sin as a dog who returns to his vomit.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 81_Para: when the heart of the King is benevolent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 82_Para: The King of all the earth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 84_Para: in the day of my distress,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 86_Para: every time I was encircled by enemy camps,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 87_Para: may He continue forever to surround me
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 89_Para: when I find favor in the eyes of the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 92_Para: let their lives be precious in Your eyes
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 93_Para: for they are children of the Almighty’s kings,8שֶׁהֵם נִקְרָאִים בְּנֵי מְלָכִים—sons of kings.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 94_Para: and see how the whole of Israel
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 97_Para: O King! His servants seek His Presence
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 101_Par: touches the apple of His eye;”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 108_Par: the children of Zorach and Peretz,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 109_Par: the twins of Tamar?9The sons of Judah from where the royal House of David were descended and from whence the Messiah will come.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 110_Par: Restore their kingdom and uproot Amalek
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 111_Par: as it is said [in Your Torah, see Deut 25:19];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 116_Par: surround Him in His Palace [the Holy Temple],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 117_Par: let them dwell in Bashan and Gilead,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 119_Par: lead Your people with Your scepter,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 123_Par: The eyes of all Israel are upon You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 125_Par: may they yet dwell in the gates of Jerusalem,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 127_Par: and then, together they will serve You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 128_Par: my Priests and my deputy Priests,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 131_Par: The magnificence of the House of Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 135_Par: then will our mouths be filled with laughter,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 138_Par: O King! [How long] will my enemies exult?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 142_Par: behold they say: “Our hands are mighty,”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 143_Par: and I have not been called
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 145_Par: O King! Rise in Your [lit. His] anger
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 147_Par: those who eat the flesh of swine,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 150_Par: He will prevail over His enemies,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 151_Par: for this is the promise of the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 153_Par: remove from us the heart of stone,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 154_Par: whiten our sins like snow and wool,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 155_Par: that we may cling to You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 156_Par: like the red to the white;10The yolk of the egg to the albumen.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 158_Par: and Your righteousness to the king’s son[s].11The Children of Israel are called the sons of kings (בְּנֵי מְלָכִים).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 159_Par: O King Who faithfully judges the poor,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 161_Par: that the pride of our spirit is broken12We are no longer haughty or arrogant.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 165_Par: [therefore] deposit our works13Our repentance and good deeds.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 166_Par: in the treasury of the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 167_Par: O King grant Your righteousness to Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 168_Par: for he is a tender youth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 170_Par: as a man clings to his wife;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 172_Par: but turn to the prayer of the destitute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 173_Par: and to all the servants of the King
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 174_Par: who are at the gate of the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 175_Par: O King, I have come to beseech Him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 176_Par: to inscribe me for a good life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 177_Par: from the abundance of His House,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 179_Par: let all nations gather in the Name of God,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 180_Par: and let them go up every year
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 181_Par: to bow in worship to the King.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 183_Par: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 185_Par: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 186_Par: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 190_Par: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 197_Par: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 199_Par: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 210_Par: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 215_Par: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 216_Par: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 217_Par: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 218_Par: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 219_Par: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 223_Par: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 224_Par: Do not enter into judgment with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 225_Par: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 226_Par: Even in His holy ones, He does not trust,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 227_Par: and the heavens are not innocent in His eyes.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 228_Par: Even more, since man is but a worm
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 229_Par: and the son of man a maggot.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 230_Par: Behold we are guilty in Your Presence,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 231_Par: we are not worthy to stand in Your Presence
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 233_Par: Who cay say: “My heart is pure,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 234_Par: I have cleansed it from sin.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 235_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 236_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 238_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 239_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 240_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 242_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 244_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 245_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 248_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 249_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 252_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 253_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 254_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 255_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 256_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 257_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 258_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 259_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 260_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 12_Chapter, 264_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 1_Parag: Master, when You call on man
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 3_Parag: do not press justice to its limits.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 4_Parag: If You combine body and soul [in judgment]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 7_Parag: Can man be innocent in judgement?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 8_Parag: Is he possessed of deeds to justify him?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 9_Parag: His birth stream is from a fetid drop,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 10_Para: his enemy is hidden within him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 11_Para: from the time of his birth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 12_Para: Lurking within him as a snare to his feet,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 14_Para: to make him fall into the abyss [of sin];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 15_Para: there is no power or might in the body
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 16_Para: to stand firm and resist him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 17_Para: From the day he attains perception,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 18_Para: he puts his life in his hand
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 22_Para: until he returns to his dust
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 24_Para: Regard O Master his sorrowful spirit,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 26_Para: You are near to these who are afar,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 27_Para: You desire the repentance of the wicked.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 28_Para: Mighty One! let Yourself be found
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 33_Para: be told to those who call in Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 35_Para: the people who proclaim Your Unity.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 37_Para: that he may not condemn us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 38_Para: rebuke the accuser that he not accuse us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 39_Para: stand up for us an upright advocate;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 42_Para: We have cast our burden upon You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 43_Para: we beseech You to sustain us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 47_Para: In You we place our trust,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 48_Para: let Your mercy come swiftly toward us;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 50_Para: we have not forgotten Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 51_Para: we beseech You, never forget us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 53_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 55_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 56_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 60_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 67_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 69_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 79_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 84_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 85_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 86_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 87_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 88_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 92_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 93_Para: Do not enter into judgment with us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 94_Para: for no living soul will be justified before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 96_Para: and his habitation they have laid waste,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 99_Para: For our souls are filled with misfortune
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 100_Par: and our lives have reached the abyss.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 101_Par: And You are our King from of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 102_Par: You do wonders in the midst of the earth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 103_Par: Bring forth our righteousness the daylight
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 104_Par: and our judgment as at noon-time.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 105_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 106_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 108_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 109_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 110_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 112_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 114_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 115_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 118_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 119_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 122_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 123_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 124_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 125_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 126_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 127_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 128_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 129_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 130_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 13_Chapter, 134_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Elyah ben Shemayah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 1_Parag: Master, when You judge man who is a worm,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 3_Parag: to be gracious and compassionate with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 4_Parag: when You sit in judgment to rebuke the guilty,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 5_Parag: clear and justify the erring and simple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 6_Parag: Grant kindness and goodness to the guilty,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 7_Parag: do not press judgment to its limits.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 8_Parag: [When] those who are poor in good deeds
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 9_Parag: and destitute in conduct, call upon You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 11_Para: We stand before You with great guilt,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 12_Para: we are ashamed to mouth a reply [excuse];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 13_Para: can man be justified before God?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 14_Para: In the Presence of His Maker,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 18_Para: he is full of iniquity and great transgression,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 20_Para: before the Supreme King of Kings,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 21_Para: he will have to give at his end.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 22_Para: His sins are engraven by his own hand,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 23_Para: his wickedness will testify against him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 24_Para: the beams of his house will reveal
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 27_Para: will scream and call out.1See Mesechet Taanis 11a; Chagigah 16a.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 28_Para: The judged will hide his face in shame,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 29_Para: he will be considered as naught
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 30_Para: when he stands before Your Presence;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 32_Para: be pleased with the work of our hands,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 35_Para: Let Your servants find favor this day,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 37_Para: they desire Your nearness as of old;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 39_Para: whiten the sins of the rose [Israel],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 43_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 45_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 46_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 50_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 57_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 59_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 70_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 75_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 76_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 77_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 78_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 79_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 83_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 84_Para: Adonoy, hear our voice in the morning,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 85_Para: morning, we pray to You and hope.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 86_Para: Draw near to our soul and redeem it,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 87_Para: redeem us for Your Name’s sake.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 90_Para: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 91_Para: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 93_Para: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 94_Para: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 95_Para: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 97_Para: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 99_Para: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 100_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 103_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 104_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 107_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 108_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 109_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 110_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 111_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 112_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 113_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 114_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 115_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 14_Chapter, 119_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Shlomo ben Yehudah Habavli.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 1_Parag: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 2_Parag: I cry out to God with my voice,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 3_Parag: in the morning, I address my prayer to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 5_Parag: Adonoy, my Rock and my Redeemer!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 6_Parag: We approach You with supplication and prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 7_Parag: we keep watch at Your door,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 8_Parag: O Mighty One in wondrous deeds,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 9_Parag: remove from us, plague and sickness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 13_Para: Almighty God Who knows man’s thoughts;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 14_Para: I cry to You in affliction and weariness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 15_Para: redeem my soul from destruction and the pit,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 16_Para: draw near to my soul and redeem it.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 17_Para: Beneficent One, Who drew me from the womb,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 18_Para: my Creator, my hope and my trust,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 19_Para: in Your hand I entrust my spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 20_Para: withhold Your anger from Your beloved ones,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 21_Para: cause not Your devoted ones to see the pit,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 22_Para: answer me Adonoy, for Your kindness is good.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 24_Para: strike with anger those who blaspheme You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 25_Para: but do not plague Your people;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 27_Para: do not abhor nor despise our cry,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 28_Para: pardon the iniquity of this people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 29_Para: We have transgressed and dealt treacherously,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 30_Para: O Rock, we have been corrupt towards You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 31_Para: Therefore, we are consumed by Your anger
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 32_Para: and we are terrified by Your rage;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 33_Para: Holy One! do not extend contention,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 34_Para: behold, my hands are stretched out to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 35_Para: on the day when I am afraid,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 36_Para: I will put my trust in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 37_Para: Your people pour out their prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 38_Para: be merciful and answer Your faithful ones,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 39_Para: do not abhor us for Your Name’s sake,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 40_Para: turn to the cry of the suffering,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 41_Para: to those who call You out of distress,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 42_Para: hear them from the high heavens,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 43_Para: You Who listens to the needy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 46_Para: they trust in You, they hope to You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 47_Para: they are counted among Your pure ones,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 49_Para: as a father has mercy on his children.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 51_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 53_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 54_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 58_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 65_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 67_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 78_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 83_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 84_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 85_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 86_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 87_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 91_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 92_Para: Let the oppressed not be put to shame,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 93_Para: let the poor and needy praise Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 96_Para: and there is no one to help.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 97_Para: For I will pardon their iniquity,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 98_Para: and their sin I will no longer mention.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 102_Par: that they have transgressed unto You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 109_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 110_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 112_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 113_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 114_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 116_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 118_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 119_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 122_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 123_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 126_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 127_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 128_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 129_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 130_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 131_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 132_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 133_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 134_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 15_Chapter, 138_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon HaBavli.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 2_Parag: You created us with compassion and pardon,1When God created man, He knew that man required His mercy and forgiveness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 3_Parag: we are the children of Your holy covenant,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 4_Parag: and You have never exchanged us;2For any other nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 5_Parag: even in our exile, You are with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 6_Parag: as You have given us hope.3By promising not to leave us even in the worst of times.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 7_Parag: And [now] pardon our iniquity and our sin
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 8_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 9_Parag: Wash away the blood and filth4Of our sins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 12_Para: and not be found to make us repulsive
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 13_Para: and let our iniquity be sought
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 16_Para: “I will forgive those that I will spare.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 17_Para: The foulness [of our sins] is great
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 18_Para: and the aroma of our sacrifices5“ניחוח ממלח“ lit. the salted pleasant odor—all sacrifices were salted before being burnt on the altar as a pleasant fragrance to God. (v. Vayikra 2, 13) has ceased.6Since the destruction of the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 20_Para: the filth of the moist creeping thing,7A ritually unclean person who has any foreign matter covering any part of his body cannot become ritually clean unless he first removes the impurity.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 21_Para: let that become cleansed by immersion
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 22_Para: in the flow of Your waters,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 23_Para: for You are Adonoy, good and forgiving.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 24_Para: Since we sinned we were exiled
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 27_Para: and there is none [priest] to sprinkle us.8With the mixture of water and ashes from the red heifer—the procedure used in purifying one who was contaminated with the ritual uncleanness of a dead body.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 29_Para: as [You did] then and before this,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 30_Para: forgive, please, the sins of this nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 31_Para: They are too abundant to relate—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 32_Para: the great goodness that You have bestowed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 34_Para: [even] when it was rebellious towards You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 36_Para: as You carried it in previous days,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 37_Para: and forgive Your nation that has sinned to You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 39_Para: let His holy spirit pour forth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 40_Para: so that we may separate ourselves [from sin],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 43_Para: The purification and the cleansing [from sin]—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 44_Para: order that they be without suffering,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 45_Para: for forgiveness is with You9It is in Your hands to forgive.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 46_Para: so that You shall be feared.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 47_Para: Stand upright the fallen one.10“Fallen one”—the Jewish nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 52_Para: rebuilt us at the time we were weakened.11“To those … rebuilt us” i.e. the righteous of every generation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 53_Para: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 55_Para: We have become as leftovers12“Leftovers”—the remains at the bottom of the pot.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 56_Para: and who, like You, can forgive [such as these].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 58_Para: will we attempt to seek a sign,13“A sign”—that You have forgiven us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 59_Para: but upon your virtue of abundant compassion
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 60_Para: we will send14נפיל—lit. “throw.” our plea.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 62_Para: Adonoy, pay attention [to us] and do!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 63_Para: In Your fear and in Your righteous Torah,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 66_Para: we have become too weak to take a step.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 70_Para: and their sins I will no longer remember.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 72_Para: of every blood and flesh.15Blood and flesh, i.e. human.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 75_Para: and they are with us everywhere.16And—everywhere, i.e. we cannot escape our sins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 77_Para: [that we may find redemption and consolation,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 78_Para: for You are the forgiving God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 81_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 83_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 84_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 88_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 95_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 97_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 108_Par: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 113_Par: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 114_Par: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 115_Par: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 116_Par: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 117_Par: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 121_Par: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 122_Par: Why do You stand from afar, Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 123_Par: hiding Yourself in times of trouble?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 124_Par: Return for the sake of Your servants
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 126_Par: You will grant truth to Jacob,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 128_Par: As You have sworn to our fathers
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 130_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 131_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 133_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 134_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 135_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 137_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 139_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 140_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 143_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 144_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 147_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 148_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 149_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 150_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 151_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 152_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 153_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 154_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 155_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 16_Chapter, 159_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon ben Menachem.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 1_Parag: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 4_Parag: by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 5_Parag: I beseech the Presence of my King
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 7_Parag: to search for the merit [of Israel]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 8_Parag: who were named and called the Rose.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 11_Para: If their guilt be so great
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 12_Para: as to reach the heavens and their stars,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 13_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 14_Para: I plead for mercy for them,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 15_Para: to annul for them what is written:1Deut. 32:26.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 16_Para: “I said I will scatter them etc.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 21_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 22_Para: cast them away, Adonoy, and conceal them;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 23_Para: let our vigorous words of supplication
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 25_Para: “I will hide [my face from them].”3Deut. 32:20.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 26_Para: Why, Adonoy, do You stand far off,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 27_Para: hiding Yourself in times of trouble?4Psalms 10:1.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 29_Para: in the Presence of their King,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 31_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 32_Para: I offer supplication with a loud voice,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 34_Para: “Pour out your heart as water”5Lamentations 2:19.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 36_Para: “Who is pure white and ruddy.”6Song of Songs 5:10.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 37_Para: “Why, God, have You cast us off forever.”7Psalms 74:1.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 40_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 41_Para: save them, Adonoy, from crushing wounds,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 43_Para: and lift up the strong voice [of redemption]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 44_Para: “Why do I go mourning under oppression.”8Psalms 42:10.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 46_Para: in words and thoughts against You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 47_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 48_Para: remember the love of those who praise You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 49_Para: and let Your compassion be moved
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 50_Para: towards the remnant of Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 53_Para: If they harden their ear [from hearing]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 55_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 56_Para: I offer silent prayer for my people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 57_Para: and my soul—pour out your heart
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 58_Para: in the Presence of your Possessor and Rock.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 59_Para: “Why have You broken down her fences,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 60_Para: so that all wayfarers pluck her fruit.”10Psalms 80:13.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 61_Para: If they have rebelled with great transgression
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 62_Para: against the Rock, my King, my Holy One;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 63_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 69_Para: do You cast off my soul?11Psalms 88:15.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 70_Para: If they were stubborn like a heifer
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 71_Para: from their many days and years [of exile];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 72_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 73_Para: I will lift my eyes to the heavens,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 74_Para: and open my mouth in behalf of my people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 75_Para: who are the fewest among peoples.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 77_Para: [and] forsake us for the length of days?”12Lamentations 5:20.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 80_Para: by virtue of every fitting attribute [I pray],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 81_Para: with a soft [birdlike] voice for wonders.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 82_Para: On Your refined [faithful] word,13That our prayers do not go unanswered. [I rely]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 86_Para: Draw it from Your bosom to consume [evil].”14Psalms 74:11.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 87_Para: If they have perverted their actions
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 89_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 90_Para: let Your heart be moved to deliver them;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 91_Para: “Arise cry out aloud in the night”15Lamentations 2:19.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 93_Para: “Why should You be like a man confused,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 94_Para: like a mighty man that cannot save.”16Jeremiah 14:9.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 95_Para: If in truth, all have repented
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 96_Para: with their heart and soul to appease You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 97_Para: [then] by virtue of every fitting attribute,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 99_Para: and do it O Master for Your sake,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 101_Par: “Return to us for the sake of Your servants,17The Patriarchs.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 104_Par: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 106_Par: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 107_Par: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 111_Par: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 118_Par: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 120_Par: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 131_Par: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 136_Par: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 137_Par: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 138_Par: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 139_Par: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 140_Par: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 144_Par: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 145_Par: Unto You Adonoy is our plea,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 146_Par: and in the morning our prayer is before You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 147_Par: Adonoy, in the morning hear our voice,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 148_Par: in the morning we beseech You and hope.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 149_Par: My soul waits for my Master
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 158_Par: As a father has compassion on his children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 159_Par: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 161_Par: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 162_Par: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 163_Par: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 165_Par: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 167_Par: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 168_Par: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 171_Par: and as You forgave this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 172_Par: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 175_Par: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 176_Par: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 177_Par: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 178_Par: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 179_Par: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 180_Par: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 181_Par: but because of Your great mercy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 182_Par: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 183_Par: My Master, listen and take action,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 17_Chapter, 187_Par: over Your city and over Your people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 0_Parag: The following prayer was composed by Rabbi Mordechai.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 1_Parag: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 2_Parag: My God Who is my savior and my strong rock
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 4_Parag: my Salvation1Lit. the horn of my salvation. He fights against my enemies as an ox who gores with its horn as it attacks. and my Assurance,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 5_Parag: during my times of trial and pain.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 6_Parag: I wake up early to pray unto You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 10_Para: In the morning remember to have mercy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 11_Para: in the merit of Abraham’s kindness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 12_Para: the first patriarch of “the strong ones,”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 17_Para: and deliver me from my sins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 18_Para: Adonoy, listen this morning to my voice,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 19_Para: to my prayer of the morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 20_Para: In the morning You spoke with him2Abraham.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 21_Para: and tested him in order to reward him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 22_Para: and You made a covenant with him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 23_Para: to serve as a protector for him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 24_Para: You loved him and wanted him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 25_Para: and accepted him like the incense
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 30_Para: You tested him a tenth time
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 31_Para: and said to him: Take your son,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 34_Para: and bring him there as a burnt offering
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 36_Para: you bring as a sacrifice in the morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 37_Para: In the morning he singularized Your Name
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 42_Para: His love made him transcend normalcy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 44_Para: And Abraham rose early in the morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 45_Para: In the morning both readied their hearts
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 46_Para: to do Your will, O awesome One.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 48_Para: and the father took the knife
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 49_Para: to slaughter without intending to redeem him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 53_Para: on the third day in the morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 54_Para: In the morning he girded himself
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 55_Para: as a warrior girds his loins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 57_Para: then took a knife to slaughter him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 58_Para: without thinking of him as a human being
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 59_Para: and said: “Today I will bring my offering
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 60_Para: and sprinkle the blood of my sacrifice.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 61_Para: It will not remain until the morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 62_Para: In the morning Your mercy was aroused
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 64_Para: and that mercy shone upon him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 65_Para: An angel of Adonoy called to him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 66_Para: and said not to harm the lad
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 69_Para: [and the merit of this event] will be remembered for all generations,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 70_Para: it will remain as a safe-keeping for you
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 71_Para: until the morning.3Until the redemption which is analogous to morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 73_Para: his4Isaac’s. propriety and righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 74_Para: will benefit the people who pray to You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 75_Para: and his ashes will always be seen before You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 76_Para: to cleanse them from their sins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 77_Para: Grant them their lives which is their request,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 78_Para: because it is You Whom they desire.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 79_Para: In the evening they come to You in prayer
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 81_Para: Harken to their voices in the morning
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 83_Para: Consider the order of their prayers
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 84_Para: like the order of the sacrifices.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 86_Para: of the righteousness of their ancestors.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 88_Para: their contributions of prayer every morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 89_Para: In the morning turn to us and have mercy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 90_Para: and let Your mercy be aroused upon us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 91_Para: Cast to the depths of the sea
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 93_Para: and let them not be remembered.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 94_Para: Lord, our Rock, pass our sins from before You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 95_Para: and let them not remain before You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 98_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 100_Par: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 101_Par: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 105_Par: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 112_Par: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 114_Par: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 125_Par: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 130_Par: and Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 131_Par: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 132_Par: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 133_Par: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 134_Par: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 138_Par: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 140_Par: Do not enter into judgment with us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 141_Par: for no living soul will be justified before You.1Psalms 143:2.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 142_Par: And He judges the inhabited world
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 144_Par: and the peoples with righteousness.2Psalms 9:9.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 146_Par: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 147_Par: kindness and truth go before Your Presence.3Psalms 89:15.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 150_Par: let Your eyes behold [my] uprightness.4Psalms 17:2.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 151_Par: And bring forth as the light
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 153_Par: and our judgment as the noonday.5Psalms 37:6.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 156_Par: for they are all Your servants.6Psalms 119:91.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 159_Par: Adonoy is our king, He will deliver us.7Isaiah 33:22.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 161_Par: repay the arrogant their just reward.8Psalms 94:2.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 162_Par: It would be sacrilege to ascribe to You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 164_Par: to kill the righteous with the wicked,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 165_Par: and let the righteous fare as the wicked;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 166_Par: it would be sacrilege to ascribe to You—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 167_Par: [that] the Judge of all the earth
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 18_Chapter, 168_Par: does not act justly.9Genesis 18:25.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Shlomo ibn Gabirol.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 1_Parag: [You are] the Judge of all the earth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 2_Parag: and You arraign her in judgment,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 3_Parag: we beseech You, life and kindness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 6_Parag: as a substitute for the burnt offering—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 7_Parag: as the burnt offering of the morning
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 8_Parag: which was a continual burnt offering.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 9_Parag: You are wrapped in a cloak of righteousness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 10_Para: You alone have the ability [to forgive],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 13_Para: of the [Patriarchs] who sleep in Hebron,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 15_Para: as a memorial before Adonoy always.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 16_Para: As the burnt offering of the morning
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 17_Para: which was a continual burnt offering.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 21_Para: be benevolent with him, that he may live,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 22_Para: inscribe him with the sign of life,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 23_Para: and let it be on his forehead always.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 24_Para: As the burnt offering of the morning
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 25_Para: which was a continual burnt offering.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 26_Para: Do good, as You see fit, to Zion,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 28_Para: Grant power and fame in Your House
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 29_Para: to my holy ones [the pious and righteous],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 30_Para: and an illuminated lamp for the son of Yishai;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 31_Para: that a light be kept burning always.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 32_Para: As the burnt offering of the morning
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 33_Para: which was a continual burnt offering.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 34_Para: Be strong and let your hearts take courage
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 35_Para: my people, whose strength is in the Almighty;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 36_Para: and when You keep His testimonies,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 37_Para: He, too, will in equal measure
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 39_Para: and will remember mercy in His anger.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 42_Para: As the burnt offering of the morning
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 43_Para: which was a continual burnt offering.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 45_Para: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 47_Para: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 48_Para: He removes their sins one by one,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 52_Para: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 59_Para: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 61_Para: to the humble Moses of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 72_Para: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 77_Para: and Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 78_Para: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 79_Para: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 80_Para: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 81_Para: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 85_Para: to all who call upon You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 86_Para: Remember not the sins of our ancestors;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 87_Para: let Your compassion come swiftly toward us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 88_Para: for we have been brought very low.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 89_Para: The sins of our youth and our transgressions,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 92_Para: for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 95_Para: for they are from the beginning of the world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 100_Par: which You have acquired of old,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 103_Par: this mountain of Zion where You have dwelled.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 104_Par: Remember, Adonoy, the affection of Jerusalem,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 105_Par: the love of Zion, forget not until eternity.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 107_Par: to the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 109_Par: “Raze it, raze it to its very foundations.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 112_Par: for it is time to be gracious to her,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 113_Par: for the appointed time has come.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 116_Par: to whom You swore by Your very Self,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 119_Par: as the stars of the heavens;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 120_Par: and all this land that I have promised,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 121_Par: I will give to your descendants,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 122_Par: and they will inherit it forever.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 125_Par: do not regard the stubborness of this people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 126_Par: or their wickedness, or their sin.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 19_Chapter, 129_Par: wherein we have acted foolishly and sinned.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 2_Parag: I have spread my hands [in prayer],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 3_Parag: I have abandoned arrogance and haughtiness.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 5_Parag: I [have brought before You as a] sacrifice,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 6_Parag: and in Your loving-kindness, I trust.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 9_Parag: even when I was threatened with death
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 12_Para: the speechless dove and nestling,1“Speechless dove”—i.e. the nation of Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 13_Para: and let him return the robbery2And—robbery, i.e. let the gentiles return the land that they robbed from us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 17_Para: He [the gentile nations] robbed and destroyed
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 20_Para: and destroyed his House3‘House’—i.e. the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 21_Para: and desecrated the Holy4Holy, i.e. the Temple. and its holies
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 22_Para: and slashed the Curtain5I.e. the curtain separating the Holy of Holies from the rest of the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 23_Para: and slaughtered his prophets and holy men,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 24_Para: that was a generation that seeked Him.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 25_Para: The blood of those that seeked Him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 26_Para: shall be a ransom and redemption
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 37_Para: fell [by the sword] from Your nation,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 39_Para: for the Unity of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 40_Para: For their sake bring forth into the light
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 44_Para: of Your servants and Your nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 45_Para: And Your nation they loot and rob
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 47_Para: and they rejoice in the fear6‘In the fear’ i.e. the fear of the Jewish Nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 48_Para: and in the breach7‘In the break’ i.e. the breach of the Jewish Nation. they revel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 49_Para: ‘And who has given Jacob to loot’
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 51_Para: “Is it not Adonoy that did this!”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 54_Para: [To this we respond] ‘Our sins caused this,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 55_Para: and [caused our] pursuer to smite us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 56_Para: We have veered from the path
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 57_Para: and like a rebellious counsel we have kicked.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 59_Para: according to the measure [that we deserve],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 60_Para: and according to our evil actions
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 62_Para: to Adonoy our God we have sinned.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 64_Para: and we are still [immersed] in great guilt.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 66_Para: we have been placed in exile.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 67_Para: [The prophecy of Scripture has befallen us:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 69_Para: Adonoy has made you wander wanderings.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 74_Para: The wolves [who attack their prey at] dusk8‘The wolves — dusk,’ i.e. the nations of the world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 77_Para: and left not even a bone till morning.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 78_Para: They are ruthless and do not take pity.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 79_Para: May pity come from the Heavens!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 81_Para: and let Him save His people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 82_Para: from the hand of the strong and violent.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 83_Para: May His beloved dwelling9I.e. the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 85_Para: as a mast and as a banner10May the Temple be so visible and prominent! at the mountaintop.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 90_Para: Masters, besides Him, lorded over us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 91_Para: Now, let it be told to Jacob11I.e. Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 94_Para: Israel to be His chosen nation.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 96_Para: let there not be pain and destruction.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 98_Para: let my ruins12I.e. Jerusalem. be rebuilt.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 99_Para: To my king let Him give strength
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 105_Par: Show me [vengeance] in my enemies,13בשוררי—lit. those who see to my destruction.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 107_Par: and the vengeance of my chosen place14‘Chosen place,’ i.e. the Temple..
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 108_Par: Transfer the pain of my shame to my enemies
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 110_Par: the shame of [the wrongdoing] of my youth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 112_Par: the love of betrothal.15‘I remember — betrothal’ i.e. I remember the kindnesses that I did for you when you first became My nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 115_Par: Please! Let my prayer be established
