text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 116_Par: as a burnt-offering.16‘Let — offering,’ i.e. let my prayer be considered as a sacrifice brought at the time of the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 117_Par: God of Jacob listen to my prayer forever.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 120_Par: You have always been a support to those who put their hope in You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 126_Par: and You will not answer them.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 127_Par: Answer [the prayers] of the House of Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 129_Par: even when You put their cities to rubble
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 131_Par: Therefore, [even when they had to hide]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 134_Par: Adonoy, in their anguish, they remembered You.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 138_Par: You to whom lips turn to call [in prayer].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 143_Par: You are their strength in time of anguish.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 147_Par: shall not be shut for me.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 148_Par: For they are gathered in Your vessel;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 149_Par: are they not counted by You, my Redeemer!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 150_Par: I have cried. Hear my voice!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 153_Par: I will raise my voice in plea
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 154_Par: [that You save me] from the oppression
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 157_Par: by the severe anger of my oppressor.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 158_Par: The mother, together with her children,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 161_Par: before her eyes are her children slaughtered.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 162_Par: Her face was put to shame
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 165_Par: from the Chamber of Hewn Stone17‘Barons — Stone’ i.e. the Sanhedrin who met in the temple in the Chamber of Hewn Stone to pass judgment.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 169_Par: to Your glorious dwelling-place18I.e. the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 170_Par: so that the remnant [of Israel] be crowned.19I.e. that the Kingdom of the House of David return.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 171_Par: Let it be heard by the fugitive of Judah
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 173_Par: so that she remain a crown of glory.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 177_Par: this nation that You have acquired.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 178_Par: You have not found them contemptuous,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 179_Par: when they have called You, You responded.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 180_Par: [Even when] a single poor person calls,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 187_Par: and who were exiled from their father’s table.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 189_Par: shall roll over my attributes.”20“Compassion — attributes” i.e. compassion shall overpower the other attributes of God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 190_Par: In Adonoy they shall find righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 191_Par: and they shall be praised [for trusting in God].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 194_Par: Those who depend on You shall be praised
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 195_Par: for their prayer and my21The שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר—who leads the congregation in prayer. prayer
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 201_Par: and the merit of the three ancients,22‘Three ancients’ i.e. the Patriarchs.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 204_Par: Remember to us the covenant of the Patriarchs,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 206_Par: “And I will remember my covenant with Jacob,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 207_Par: and also my covenant with Isaac,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 208_Par: and also my covenant with Abraham
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 20_Chapter, 210_Par: and the land I will remember.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Gershom ben Yehudah (the Light of the Exile).
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 6_Parag: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 7_Parag: We lost the good land all too soon,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 8_Parag: and the prophesied exile has lasted very long;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 9_Parag: in Israel, they no longer live in open villages,1They must live in fortified cities for fear of enemy attack.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 10_Para: our plenty has been turned into famine.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 13_Para: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 15_Para: has all of Judah been exiled,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 16_Para: grief and destruction is her lot each day,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 17_Para: and there is none to inquire or plead for her.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 20_Para: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 21_Para: The city of holiness and its environs
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 23_Para: all its treasures are buried and hidden,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 24_Para: and nothing remains except this Torah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 27_Para: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 28_Para: Mighty Redeemer, for Your sake redeem us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 30_Para: look, our pious men are gone,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 31_Para: and we have none to intercede for us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 34_Para: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 40_Para: to those who are stricken and tortured,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 41_Para: and for Your sake [they are ready]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 42_Para: to be killed all the day.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 45_Para: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 49_Para: into the bosom of those who torment us;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 50_Para: we have been sold for naught,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 52_Para: raise up Your ruined, Holy Temple,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 56_Para: and deliver us for the sake of Your Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 58_Para: Remember to us the covenant of the ancestors,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 60_Para: “And I will remember for their sake
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 64_Para: in the sight of the nations;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 68_Para: and reign over all in Your Oneness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 69_Para: as it is written by Your prophets:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 21_Chapter, 72_Para: on that day Adonoy will be One
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 3_Parag: Our King! We come before You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 4_Parag: with the power of Your Unity,1I.e. with the merit that we express the Unity of the Name of God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 7_Parag: but with [our acceptance of] Your Kingdom
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 11_Para: We will express Your Unity together,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 13_Para: Please erase our writs of guilt,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 14_Para: and inscribe in the Book of Life
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 17_Para: that our years be for good.2‘Years for good,’ i.e. that we have a good life.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 23_Para: in Your Name they find protection
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 24_Para: and the Sh’ma they read with blessings.3‘Sh’ma — blessings,’ i.e. twice a day they read the Sh’ma with the appropriate blessings before and after.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 28_Para: trust in the Name of Adonoy, our God.4‘These nations — God,’ i.e. whereas, other nations depend on the might of their weapons we depend solely on the help of God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 33_Para: as promised in Your holy word5I.e. the Holy Scriptures.:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 35_Para: and we will rise and be strengthened.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 39_Para: The Inside Services have come to an end6I.e. the Service of Yom Kippur in the Holy of Holies can no longer be performed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 40_Para: [so, too, the Service of] the goats of atonement.7I.e. the service of the “two goats” performed only on Yom Kippur.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 41_Para: And the priest is no more
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 44_Para: like the heart of a woman
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 45_Para: who is in fear of her labor pains,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 46_Para: we depend on that which was said:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 51_Para: “I am for Adonoy” without deceit8I.e. they say this with all sincerity.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 53_Para: proclaim that they are of Jacob,9I.e. despite their wrongdoing, their allegiance remains with the Jewish nation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 54_Para: and they all depend on the promise
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 55_Para: that the God of Jacob [will redeem them].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 59_Para: We are called by Your name10I.e. we are called the people of God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 61_Para: Turn towards us to our cries
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 63_Para: And remove from us our evil deeds
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 67_Para: Awaken those who slumber11I.e. those whom the suffering of the exile has desensitized.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 69_Para: Redeem them and cleanse them of their stains,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 71_Para: Who sits on the throne of compassion.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 72_Para: Do unto us as You promised,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 74_Para: when they are in the land of their enemies,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 76_Para: and I will not abhor them, to destroy them,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 77_Para: to annul My covenant with them;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 78_Para: for I am Adonoy, their God.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 79_Para: Be accessible to us when we seek You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 82_Para: you will seek Adonoy, your God,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 89_Para: as it is written in Your Torah:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 90_Para: “And Adonoy, your God will open your heart,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 91_Para: and the heart of your descendants,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 97_Para: and cleanse us, as it is written:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 98_Para: “And I will sprinkle clean water upon you,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 104_Par: as a thick cloud and as a mist,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 106_Par: “I have swept away like a thick cloud
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 108_Par: and like a mist, your sins;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 109_Par: return to Me, for I have redeemed You.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 110_Par: Blot out our transgressions for Your sake,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 115_Par: and your sins, I will not recall.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 116_Par: Make our sins as white as snow or wool,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 120_Par: though your sins be as scarlet,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 121_Par: they shall be as white as snow;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 122_Par: though they be red as crimson,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 124_Par: Have compassion on us and do not destroy us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 126_Par: “For an Almighty of mercy is Adonoy,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 128_Par: He will not abandon you or destroy you,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 132_Par: Gather our dispersed ones, as it is written:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 134_Par: are in the farthermost part of heaven,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 135_Par: from there Adonoy, your God will gather you,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 136_Par: and from there He will take you.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 141_Par: your captivity and have compassion on you;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 142_Par: and He will again gather you
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 144_Par: where Adonoy, your God has scattered you.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 145_Par: Bring us to Your holy mountain,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 146_Par: and make us joyful in Your House of Prayer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 148_Par: “And I will bring them to My holy mountain,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 149_Par: and make them joyful in My House of Prayer;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 151_Par: will be accepted with favor on My Altar,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 22_Chapter, 153_Par: will be called a House of Prayer
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 0_Parag: The following verses until “When our strength fails, do not forsake us” are chanted by the Chazzan and repeated by the Congregation.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 2_Parag: Hear our voice, Adonoy, our God;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 3_Parag: spare us and have compassion on us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 6_Parag: Lead us back to You, Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 7_Parag: and we shall find the way back;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 8_Parag: renew our days as of old.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 9_Parag: Cast us not away from Your Presence,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 10_Para: and Your holy spirit take not from us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 11_Para: Do not cast us off in time of old age,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 12_Para: when our strength fails, do not forsake us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 13_Para: Forsake us not, Adonoy, our God
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 14_Para: be not far removed from us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 15_Para: Give us a sign of Your goodness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 16_Para: that our enemies may see it and be ashamed;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 17_Para: for You, Adonoy, have helped us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 19_Para: Give ear to our words, Adonoy!
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 22_Para: for the words of our mouth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 23_Para: and the meditation of our heart,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 25_Para: Adonoy, our Rock, and our Redeemer.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 26_Para: For to You Adonoy, we hope
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 23_Chapter, 27_Para: You will answer us Adonoy, our God.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 0_Parag: The following prayer was composed by Rabbi Saadyah Gaon.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 1_Parag: And so may it be Your will
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 2_Parag: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 5_Parag: and for all Your people, the House of Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 6_Parag: the end and limit of the captivity
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 7_Parag: of Your people, the House of Israel;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 8_Parag: and the last of our exile and mourning,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 10_Para: to our days of affliction and misery;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 11_Para: for our servitude has been protracted,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 12_Para: and the yoke of captivity is long upon us;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 14_Para: we become more and more diminished,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 15_Para: and with the increase in years,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 17_Para: and in the length of time,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 20_Para: nor anyone to strengthen our hands,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 22_Para: “For who will have pity on you, Jerusalem?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 23_Para: And who will moan over you?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 27_Para: and who will stand in the breach?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 28_Para: There is no longer a prophet or seer,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 30_Para: that calls upon Your Name in truth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 31_Para: that is inspired to grasp You;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 32_Para: for we are all like sheep gone astray,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 34_Para: has turned to his evil way,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 37_Para: after the desire of his evil heart;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 38_Para: and, as if we were not content
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 40_Para: we have added new ones to them,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 41_Para: we were heedless of all the warnings
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 46_Para: and what other righteousness have we
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 47_Para: that we can cry out to the King?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 48_Para: Our God and God of our fathers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 49_Para: let our prayer come before you
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 50_Para: and do not ignore our supplication.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 51_Para: For we are not so brazen-faced
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 54_Para: Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 55_Para: “We are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 56_Para: But, indeed, we and our fathers have sinned.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 57_Para: We have trespassed [against God and man, and we are devastated by our guilt];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 58_Para: We have betrayed [God and man, we have been ungrateful for the good done to us];
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 59_Para: We have stolen; We have slandered;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 60_Para: We have caused others to sin;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 61_Para: We have caused others to commit sins for which they are called רֽשָׁעִים, wicked;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 62_Para: We have sinned with malicious intent;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 63_Para: We have forcibly taken other’s possessions
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 64_Para: We have added falsehood upon falsehood; We have joined with evil individuals or groups.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 66_Para: We have deceived; We have mocked;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 67_Para: We have rebelled against God and His Torah;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 68_Para: We have caused God to be angry with us;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 69_Para: We have turned away from God’s Torah;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 71_Para: We have been negligent in our performance of the commandments;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 72_Para: We have caused our friends grief;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 73_Para: We have been stiff-necked, refusing to admit that the cause of our suffering is our own sins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 74_Para: We have committed sins for which we are called רָשָׁע, [raising a hand to hit someone].
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 75_Para: We have committed sins which are the result of moral corruption;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 76_Para: We have committed sins which the Torah refers to as abominations;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 82_Para: and we have gained nothing from it.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 83_Para: And You are the Righteous One
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 24_Chapter, 84_Para: in all [punishment] that has come upon us;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer too was composed by R’ Saadyah Gaon.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 2_Parag: and been mindless of Your great kindnesses;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 3_Parag: we have rebelled against Your word,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 4_Parag: and have turned away from Your laws.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 5_Parag: We have indulged in the vanities of this world,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 6_Parag: and to men of arrogance and deceit
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 9_Parag: we have loved evil more than good,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 12_Para: we have sought impurity rather than purity,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 13_Para: and the loathsome rather than the clean;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 16_Para: Day by day we rise early to sin,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 18_Para: our iniquities have mounted above our heads,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 19_Para: and are more numerous than our hairs,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 21_Para: than the words of our mouth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 22_Para: and exceeded the steps of our feet,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 23_Para: and surpassed the breathing of our nostrils.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 24_Para: We have sunk into muddy depths,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 26_Para: we have come into deep waters,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 27_Para: and a whirlpool has swept us away.1Psalms 69:3.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 28_Para: Not You Adonoy, our God, have we harmed,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 33_Para: what effect has it on You?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 35_Para: what does it do to You?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 36_Para: But woe to the sons of man
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 39_Para: for they bring evil upon themselves.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 40_Para: Our God, we are too ashamed and disgraced,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 41_Para: to lift our faces to You, our God;2Ezra 9:6.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 42_Para: for we are like a repulsive vessel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 43_Para: thus are we disgraced in our own eyes.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 44_Para: As a man immersed in a [muddy] ditch
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 45_Para: and soils his clothing;3Job 9:31.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 46_Para: and as we were conceived in iniquity,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 25_Chapter, 47_Para: so the shame of our faces have covered us.4Psalms 44:16.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 0_Parag: This prayer, too, was composed by R’ Saadyah Gaon.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 2_Parag: after we have repented, we regret [our sins],
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 4_Parag: we struck ourselves on the thigh.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 6_Parag: for we also bear the shame of our youth.1Jeremiah 31:18.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 8_Parag: we take our flesh in our teeth,2We bite ourselves.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 9_Parag: and put our life in our hands.3Job 13:14.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 12_Para: and how shall we bow unto You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 14_Para: How will You be reconciled to us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 16_Para: which have passed by and gone
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 17_Para: like water spilt on the ground,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 18_Para: which cannot be gathered up again?5II Samuel 14:14.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 20_Para: You will be reconciled to us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 24_Para: and that which is straight, we distorted,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 25_Para: and it has not profited us.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 26_Para: And if through prayer and supplication
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 28_Para: behold we offer our supplication before You;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 30_Para: toward the hand of their master,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 31_Para: as the eyes of a maiden [look]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 32_Para: toward the hand of her mistress;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 33_Para: so our eyes are lifted to You.”6Psalms 123:2.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 34_Para: And if through weeping and wailing
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 36_Para: behold, our soul weeps in secret
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 38_Para: and our spirit groans within us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 39_Para: over the multitude of our transgressions.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 40_Para: And if through a broken spirit,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 42_Para: behold our heart is broken within us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 48_Para: Were it not for Your mercy and kindness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 56_Para: our hearts are miserable with our sins;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 57_Para: [the place of] our desire has been devastated,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 58_Para: [the place of] our glory has been humiliated,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 59_Para: the abode of our Holy Temple
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 60_Para: has been destroyed because of our iniquities;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 61_Para: our Palace has become a desolation,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 62_Para: our beautiful land belongs to strangers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 64_Para: Still, we have not repented our errors,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 65_Para: so how can we be so insolent
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 68_Para: “Adonoy, our God, and God of our fathers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 69_Para: we are righteous and have not sinned.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 70_Para: But indeed we and our fathers have sinned:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 73_Para: if we did like our foolishness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 74_Para: You do according to Your trait and forgive
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 75_Para: because You are perfect and complete.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 76_Para: If we repaid evil in exchange for good
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 77_Para: still grant us good and not evil;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 78_Para: because even a righteous person forgives
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 79_Para: and certainly the Creator should do this.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 81_Para: You are capable of excessive kindness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 84_Para: are greater than high and mighty mountains,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 85_Para: and more profound than the greatest depths.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 87_Para: and Your praise fills the earth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 89_Para: that with one of Your character traits
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 90_Para: You forgive those who sinned against You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 91_Para: and even all of those who sinned.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 92_Para: Forgive our intentional and unintentional sins
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 93_Para: and all the sins and iniquities of Israel,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 94_Para: and cleanse us from our iniquity
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 95_Para: and purify us from our sins.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 96_Para: Don’t be excessively angry at us
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 97_Para: and don’t remember our iniquity forever,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 98_Para: since You have the vast capacity to forgive.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 100_Par: intended to rid us of our refuse,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 101_Par: and to remove our unworthiness1Lit. tin.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 103_Par: and destroy our defilement from within us.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 105_Par: and scattered us among the nations.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 106_Par: Behold, in the pandemonium of kingdoms
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 108_Par: and like the smelting of silver
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 109_Par: in a vat we were melted
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 110_Par: and it was not because of Your inability
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 111_Par: that You did not save us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 112_Par: nor because of deafness in Your ears
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 113_Par: that You did not hear our prayers.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 120_Par: because we have rebelled against Him
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 121_Par: and to You, God, is only kindness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 123_Par: a person according to his deeds.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 125_Par: Redeemer of Israel and its Holy One,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 126_Par: will You eternally be angry at us?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 127_Par: Will Your anger endure for all generations?
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 132_Par: Because forever there will not cease
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 134_Par: and Your mercy will not stop
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 135_Par: since this trait is renewed daily
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 136_Par: and is created at all times
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 138_Par: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 139_Par: perform with us (your kindness and forgive us)
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 141_Par: and because Your Name is called upon us,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 143_Par: and for the sake of the covenant,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 144_Par: with our ancestors Abraham, Isaac and Jacob,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 147_Par: that You swore to them, remember.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 148_Par: And for the sake of Your Torah
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 149_Par: and the holy ones who study it,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 150_Par: for they have been diminished and subdued.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 151_Par: And You have promised us in its regard
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 152_Par: that the Law will never be forgotten
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 154_Par: “And My words that I placed in their mouths
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 156_Par: and for the sake of Your nation and inheritance
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 157_Par: of which only a few remain from many
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 158_Par: as a rod placed on a mountain top
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 159_Par: or a banner on a hill.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 160_Par: For the sake of Jerusalem, Your holy city,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 162_Par: and all its glory was taken from it;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 164_Par: of our house of life and beauty
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 165_Par: that for which our ancestors praised You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 166_Par: and that was consumed by fire,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 167_Par: and all of its treasures destroyed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 168_Par: For the sake of those who were killed
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 170_Par: and for those who were slaughtered
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 172_Par: For the sake of Your holy Torah
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 174_Par: and cast to be trodden upon
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 176_Par: In view of all these tragedies
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 182_Par: whereas the poor of Your people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 183_Par: are tormented and denigrated and unsettled
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 184_Par: and in their turmoil they seek You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 186_Par: opposite the Ark of Your covenant.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 189_Par: not to have mercy on Jerusalem
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 195_Par: There is no one to unite and help them
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 196_Par: and there is no savior for Israel.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 197_Par: We have turned to the right
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 199_Par: to the left and there is no support,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 201_Par: we can rely on no one
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 204_Par: Now is the time and the opportunity
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 205_Par: that it behooves You to help
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 209_Par: for it [Your mercy] is very great.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 210_Par: When Israel sinned in the desert,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 215_Par: and said the following in his prayer:
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 217_Par: please forgive the sin of this people
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 218_Par: with the immensity of Your kindness,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 219_Par: just as You forgave this nation
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 220_Par: from Egypt until the present time.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 223_Par: and You spoke and said to him,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 225_Par: We are ashamed of our actions
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 226_Par: and we are disgraced with our sins
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 231_Par: and we have no excuse to offer
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 26_Chapter, 232_Par: nor audacity to raise our heads.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 0_Parag: The following prayer was composed by R’ Saadyah Gaon.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 1_Parag: We beseech You, look at the righteousness
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 2_Parag: of Your servants and Your pious ones,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 3_Parag: who exposed themselves to death for You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 6_Parag: but rejected the life of this world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 7_Parag: They subjected their will to Your will
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 10_Para: They willingly offered themselves as sacrifices;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 12_Para: and withstood the test, and were found true;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 15_Para: The blood of fathers and sons merged,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 16_Para: also the blood of mothers and children;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 17_Para: the blood of brothers and sisters were mingled,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 18_Para: also the blood of bridgrooms and brides,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 19_Para: the blood of wise men and women,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 20_Para: the blood of worthy men and women,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 21_Para: the blood of young men and women,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 24_Para: the blood of pious men and women,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 25_Para: the blood of old men and women,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 26_Para: the blood of judges and their scribes,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 27_Para: the blood of teachers and their pupils;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 28_Para: the blood of husbands and their wives;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 31_Para: of Your holy and unique Name.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 33_Para: and let their cry find no [resting] place,1Job 16:18.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 34_Para: until Adonoy looks from heaven and sees,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 36_Para: and the vengeance of His people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 37_Para: and the vengeance of His Torah,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 38_Para: and the vengeance of His servants
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 39_Para: whose blood was poured like water;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 41_Para: through [Moses], the father of all prophets,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 42_Para: “Sing the praises of His people, you nations,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 43_Para: for the blood of His servants, He will avenge,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 44_Para: and vengeance will He repay to His foes;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 45_Para: and His land will be atoned
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 46_Para: [with the atonement] of His people.”2Deuteronomy 32:43.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 51_Para: and the angels cried without,3Isaiah 33:7.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 52_Para: and You swore that You would bless,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 56_Para: like the sand of the sea.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 58_Para: that so many [sacrificed] bound their children
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 59_Para: for the unity of Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 61_Para: We beseech You, Avenger of blood,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 62_Para: the voice of Your children’s blood,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 63_Para: cry out to You from the earth,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 64_Para: and let the land not atone
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 65_Para: the blood that was spilled in her,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 66_Para: except with the blood of those who spilt it.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 67_Para: And let Your mind be changed,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 68_Para: and let Your anger be stilled,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 72_Para: Spare and have mercy on the escaped remnant,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 73_Para: and bring them from darkness to light,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 74_Para: and grant us a good year,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 75_Para: a year of favor and time of redemption.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 79_Para: the merit of [Isaac], who was bound,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 81_Para: for the piety of [Jacob] the perfect man.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 82_Para: And You are the Righteous One
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 27_Chapter, 83_Para: over all that has come upon us;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 1_Parag: The cry of those who praise You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 2_Parag: may it rise before Your Throne of Honor.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 4_Parag: the people that proclaim Your Unity,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 5_Parag: [You, Who] listens to the prayer of
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 9_Parag: for the delay and distortion of justice,1I.e. for the distortion that we committed.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 10_Para: for if [You will judge] according to justice2I.e. according to what we really deserve.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 11_Para: who will [be considered] righteous before You,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 13_Para: The hands of the expelled people,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 16_Para: for if [You do to them] as they deserve
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 18_Para: that they [remain] alive.3We ask that we be judged more leniently than we deserve.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 20_Para: with the utterances of my mouth.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 22_Para: in [the place] of perfect splendor,4I.e., the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 23_Para: for if [You judge me] according to [my] fault
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 24_Para: then I place my hand to my mouth.5I.e., then I am struck speechless.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 28_Para: and do not pay according to our deeds,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 31_Para: “I have cleansed my heart from deception.”
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 32_Para: And if we have perverted Your command,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 33_Para: [nevertheless], heed us and accept our song,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 34_Para: for according to what [we have] perverted
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 36_Para: they that reside in mud huts.6I.e., those that reside in this lowly world.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 37_Para: With compassion and not with anger,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 38_Para: act [towards us] today and every day,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 28_Chapter, 40_Para: we would not know what to do.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 0_Parag: The following prayer was composed by Rabbi Meir ben Isaac.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 1_Parag: Receive our prayer, accept our supplication
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 3_Parag: of the continual morning offering.1After the destruction of the Temple, prayers replaced the daily offerings. See Mesechet Berachos 26b.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 4_Parag: Consider those who rise to praise Your Name,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 5_Parag: as though they had been privileged
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 6_Parag: to remove the ashes from the Altar.2The removal of the ashes from the Altar was the first function of the sacrificial order.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 8_Parag: in the sanctuary [synagogues] of their exile
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 9_Parag: as if it were the “Chavittin” in the Temple.3These were daily meal offerings brought by the Kohen Gadol.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 10_Para: Listen to our reading [of the Sh’ma]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 11_Para: and the order of our Amidah prayers,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 12_Para: as the burning of the limbs and fat pieces.4If these were not consumed on the Altar at night, they were placed at the sides of the Altar in the morning. See Mesechet Tamid 2:1.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 13_Para: Consider the spreading of our hands [in prayer]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 15_Para: as the bringing up of the ashes to the heap.5The sacrificial ashes were heaped on the Altar.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 17_Para: as the wood on the Altar that faced eastward.6See Mesechet Tamid 2:4.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 18_Para: May it be pleasant before You
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 19_Para: how they place their feet together at prayer,7During the Amidah prayers.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 20_Para: as the service of the [proper] kohain
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 21_Para: when he arranged the two wood piles.8One on the sacrificial Altar and one on the incense Altar.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 23_Para: of those who approach You in worship,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 24_Para: as those of the kohanim in the Sanctuary
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 25_Para: who rushed to draw lots [to serve You].9The priests drew lots each day for the privilege of performing various services in the Temple.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 26_Para: May our rising early to pray at dawn,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 27_Para: as the stars go up in song, be considered
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 28_Para: as those who announced the dawn,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 29_Para: evoking the merit of Hebron.10Before the daily morning sacrifice was offered, they would go up on the roof to see if the daylight had reached Hebron, where the Patriarchs are buried.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 35_Para: it was given to drink,11This was done to facilitate the skinning which was done later.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 36_Para: and was examined again by torchlight.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 37_Para: The kohain who won the privilege
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 39_Para: and who allotted twelve of his brethren
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 40_Para: [the privilege of assisting him]—brought the lamb to the slaughter house.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 42_Para: until the large gate was opened.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 43_Para: He maneuvered his hand, up to his elbow,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 44_Para: into the opening of the gate [to open one lock]
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 45_Para: two keys were needed for opening the gate.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 46_Para: When the door turned on its hinges,
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 47_Para: it would give out a creaking sound
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 48_Para: that was heard in the plain of Jericho.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 51_Para: binding the fore and hind legs
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 52_Para: as Isaac was bound on Mount Moriah.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 54_Para: that it be used for slaughtering,12This ring was used to hold the head of the lamb when it was slaughtered.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 55_Para: both the morning and afternoon sacrifices
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 56_Para: were performed facing the sun.13In the morning it was offered in the northwest corner and in the evening in the northeast so as to face the sun.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 58_Para: against the four sides of the Altar—
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 60_Para: and once on the southwest corner.
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 61_Para: The remaining blood was poured out
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 62_Para: at the southern base of the Altar;
text.7_Erev Rosh Hashana, 29_Chapter, 63_Para: and the lamb had to be skinned,

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 129_Parag: And the heavens will praise Your wonders,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 132_Parag: in the assembly of holy ones.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 133_Parag: Come let us sing to Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 135_Parag: to the Rock of our deliverance.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 136_Parag: Let us greet His Presence with thanksgiving,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 137_Parag: with hymns let us raise our voices unto Him.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 139_Parag: are the foundations of Your throne,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 140_Parag: kindness and truth precede Your Presence.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 141_Parag: For together let us take sweet counsel;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 143_Parag: let us walk with the throngs.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 144_Parag: For the sea is His, and He made it;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 145_Parag: and the dry land, His hands formed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 147_Parag: is the soul of every living thing,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 148_Parag: and the spirit of all human flesh.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 150_Parag: and the body is Your doing,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 152_Parag: The soul is Yours, and the body is Yours,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 154_Parag: for the sake of Your Name.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 155_Parag: We have come [relying] on Your Name,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 157_Parag: for the sake of Your Name.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 158_Parag: For the sake of the glory of Your Name,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 161_Parag: For the sake of Your Name, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 1_Chapter, 162_Parag: pardon our iniquity, for it is great.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 0_Paragra: The following prayer was composed by Rabbi Solomon ben Isaac (Rashi).
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 1_Paragra: Even before the clouds were stretched above,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 2_Paragra: and the soil was joined together on earth,1Before God created heaven and earth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 8_Paragra: The beauty of Paradise; and the flames of Hell;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 9_Paragra: and a Place of atonement [the Altar]
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 10_Paragr: by virtue of the offerings [brought thereon];
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 11_Paragr: and the glorious name of the Moshiach
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 12_Paragr: which has been desecrated through our sins.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 13_Paragr: All these were created two thousand years
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 14_Paragr: before the creation of the inhabited earth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 15_Paragr: They are arranged above the firmament,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 18_Paragr: before Him Who dwells over the Cherubim.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 19_Paragr: His throne was placed in the firmament,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 22_Paragr: Whose awe is upon all that surround Him.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 23_Paragr: From His right hand [He gave us the Torah]
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 24_Paragr: a fiery law engraved in writing,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 25_Paragr: which was set on His knees
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 27_Paragr: Situated on the south, was the Garden of Eden,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 34_Paragr: set in its center was the Altar,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 37_Paragr: on the hewn, foundation stone.2From which God shaped the world.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 43_Paragr: before Him Who blesses His people with rain
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 44_Paragr: repentance is joined [with the other six objects],
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 45_Paragr: it is the remedy for the sick and grieved.3Because of their sins and transgressions.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 46_Paragr: It is ready to cleanse the filth,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 49_Paragr: on the heads of the penitent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 52_Paragr: to cleanse us from the stench [of sin],
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 53_Paragr: and cast away the record of our iniquity.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 59_Paragr: as the burning of sacrificial blood and fat,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 60_Paragr: and accept the murmuring of our lips
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 61_Paragr: as the sacrificial pieces of bullocks and lambs.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 62_Paragr: Cause our sins to sink into the earth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 63_Paragr: there where water drips.4Causing the earth to be soft and absorbent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 65_Paragr: under the wings of Your abundant mercy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 68_Paragr: and on Your righteousness, we rely,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 69_Paragr: and for Your pardon, we hope,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 70_Paragr: and for Your deliverance, we yearn.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 72_Paragr: Who loves righteousness from of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 73_Paragr: Who passes over the iniquities of His people,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 74_Paragr: and removes the sins of those who fear Him.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 75_Paragr: You made a covenant with the Patriarchs,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 79_Paragr: in the cloud of Your glory, on Mount Sinai,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 80_Paragr: and disclosed the ways of Your goodness
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 84_Paragr: and You made known to him
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 85_Paragr: that You are Almighty, Merciful, Gracious,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 86_Paragr: Slow to anger, Abounding in kindness,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 94_Paragr: and I will proclaim the Name, Adonoy
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 97_Paragr: to whom I will be gracious,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 99_Paragr: to whom I will be compassionate.’”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 100_Parag: You are Almighty, Slow to Anger,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 101_Parag: Lord of Mercy, You are called,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 102_Parag: and the way of repentance, You have taught us.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 103_Parag: The greatness of Your mercy and kindliness,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 104_Parag: remember this day and every day
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 105_Parag: for the descendants of Your loved ones.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 107_Parag: for You are the Lord of Mercy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 111_Parag: to [Moses,] the modest one of old.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 113_Parag: as it is written in Your Torah.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 114_Parag: In the shadow of Your wings,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 115_Parag: may we be sheltered and lodged,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 116_Parag: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 120_Parag: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 124_Parag: as on the day [of which it is said:]
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 133_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 138_Parag: And Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 139_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 140_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 141_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 142_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 146_Parag: to all who call upon You.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 147_Parag: Seek Adonoy while He may be found,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 148_Parag: call upon Him while He is near.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 149_Parag: “Return to Me, and I will return to you,”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 153_Parag: and turn from His fierce anger,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 155_Parag: He who knows shall return and repent,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 156_Parag: and leave a blessing after him.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 157_Parag: Rend your hearts, not [merely] your clothes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 158_Parag: and return to Adonoy, your God.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 159_Parag: For He is gracious and merciful,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 160_Parag: slow to anger and abundant in kindness,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 162_Parag: As a father has compassion on his children
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 163_Parag: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 165_Parag: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 166_Parag: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 167_Parag: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 169_Parag: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 171_Parag: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 173_Parag: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 176_Parag: and as You forgave this people
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 177_Parag: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 181_Parag: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 182_Parag: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 183_Parag: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 184_Parag: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 185_Parag: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 186_Parag: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 187_Parag: but because of Your great mercy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 188_Parag: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 189_Parag: My Master, listen and take action,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 2_Chapter, 193_Parag: over Your city and over Your people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 1_Paragra: While Adonoy may be found,1Especially during the Ten Days of Penitence.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 2_Paragra: I rise early to seek Him;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 3_Paragra: to entreat Him to atone [my] iniquities,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 4_Paragra: for I am red [with sin] as scarlet.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 5_Paragra: My heart is confused and benumbed,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 6_Paragra: and as one asleep, I drowse.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 7_Paragra: I have become almost like Sodom,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 8_Paragra: and to Gomorrah am I likened.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 11_Paragr: I have become like a polluted garment,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 15_Paragr: and one that knows how to pray [for me].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 17_Paragr: for I have become repulsive.2Lamentations 1:11.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 18_Paragr: [Israel] the honored one has become repulsive
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 19_Paragr: in the hands of those who besmirch her;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 20_Paragr: she has been sold for naught forever,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 21_Paragr: and there is none to redeem her.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 22_Paragr: That which was firm and upraised3The Holy Temple. has sunken
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 23_Paragr: and the Ariel [the Altar] has been destroyed;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 24_Paragr: cast down from heaven to the earth,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 25_Paragr: is the glory of Israel.4Lamentations 2:1.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 26_Paragr: Israel is a prey to robbers and vandals—
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 28_Paragr: Numerous as locusts are my pursuers
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 31_Paragr: my ruin, my destruction and my devastation,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 32_Paragr: my soul prefers [to die from] strangulation,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 33_Paragr: and death rather than to dwell in my bones.5My soul prefers death rather than dwell within me.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 36_Paragr: by those who provoke and blaspheme You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 38_Paragr: “I cannot bear Your anger and Your wrath.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 39_Paragr: May it be in Your heart
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 40_Paragr: to redeem the life of Your beloved ones,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 42_Paragr: on Your city and on Your people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 46_Paragr: and fear You in deed and thought.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 48_Paragr: and forgive and heal their negligence.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 50_Paragr: let Your ears be attentive [to our prayer].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 52_Paragr: to the outpouring of our pleading,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 53_Paragr: let the praise of our lips be acceptable
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 54_Paragr: as the sweet savor of our sacrifices.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 56_Paragr: and in You we place our trust,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 57_Paragr: for we are called by Your Name,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 59_Paragr: You have abandoned us, O Master,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 61_Paragr: We have become as astonishment, an example,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 63_Paragr: a shame and disgrace.6Among the nations of the world who persecute us.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 65_Paragr: that You made to the desolate [land]:
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 67_Paragr: and plant that which was desolate.”7Ezekiel 36:36.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 69_Paragr: in Your great mercy, rebuild it,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 72_Paragr: for the time to favor her is come.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 74_Paragr: shield them in the shadow of Your hand,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 75_Paragr: and may the redeemed ones of Adonoy, return
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 76_Paragr: and come to Zion with singing.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 78_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 80_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 81_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 85_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 92_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 94_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 105_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 110_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 111_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 112_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 113_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 114_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 118_Parag: to all who call upon You.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 121_Parag: Seek Adonoy while He may be found
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 122_Parag: call upon Him while He is near.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 123_Parag: Let the wicked one forsake his way,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 124_Parag: and the man of deceit, his thoughts;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 125_Parag: and let him return to Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 126_Parag: and He will have compassion for him,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 130_Parag: for you have failed by your iniquity.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 131_Parag: As a father has compassion on his children
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 132_Parag: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 134_Parag: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 135_Parag: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 136_Parag: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 138_Parag: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 140_Parag: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 141_Parag: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 144_Parag: and as You forgave this people
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 145_Parag: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 148_Parag: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 149_Parag: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 150_Parag: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 151_Parag: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 152_Parag: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 153_Parag: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 154_Parag: but because of Your great mercy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 155_Parag: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 3_Chapter, 156_Parag: My Master, listen and take action,

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 0_Paragra: This prayer was composed by Rav Saadyah Gaon.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 1_Paragra: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 2_Paragra: My soul mourns and my face is darkened,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 3_Paragra: [because] the House of my glory1The Holy Temple.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 4_Paragra: has been smashed by the lion;2Nevuchadnetsar.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 7_Paragra: were crushed on the third day of Tishri.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 13_Paragr: who escaped the day of vengeance,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 15_Paragr: on the fast day of Gedaliah ben Achikam.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 16_Paragr: The poor among the people were torn apart,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 17_Paragr: that which was left by the caterpillar,3Nevuchadnetsar.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 18_Paragr: was quickly devoured by the locust;4Ishmael ben Netanya.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 20_Paragr: that were left on the orders of Nevuchadnetsar,5Lit. “the earth shakers.” See Jeremiah 52:16.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 22_Paragr: and there was none left to erect a fence
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 23_Paragr: and to stand in the breach.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 25_Paragr: when my groaning is so heavy?
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 32_Paragr: How long will You hide your face from us?
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 36_Paragr: there is no one to plead in our behalf,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 37_Paragr: look on our misery [and redeem us],
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 38_Paragr: and we will crown You with Your praise.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 42_Paragr: the fangs of the flying viper
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 45_Paragr: be aroused and awake for our justification,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 47_Paragr: and call an end [to our suffering].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 49_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 51_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 52_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 56_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 63_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 65_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 76_Paragr: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 81_Paragr: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 82_Paragr: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 83_Paragr: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 84_Paragr: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 85_Paragr: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 89_Paragr: to all who call upon You.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 90_Paragr: Seek Adonoy while He may be found
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 91_Paragr: call upon while He is near.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 95_Paragr: for You are Adonoy, our God.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 96_Paragr: Return, Israel to Adonoy, Your God,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 97_Paragr: for you have failed by your iniquity.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 98_Paragr: As a father has compassion on his children
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 99_Paragr: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 101_Parag: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 102_Parag: Adonoy of Hosts is with us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 103_Parag: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 105_Parag: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 107_Parag: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 108_Parag: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 111_Parag: and as You forgave this people
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 112_Parag: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 115_Parag: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 116_Parag: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 117_Parag: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 118_Parag: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 119_Parag: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 120_Parag: that we let fall our supplication before You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 121_Parag: but because of Your great mercy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 122_Parag: My Master, hear! My Master, pardon!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 123_Parag: My Master, listen and take action,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 4_Chapter, 127_Parag: over Your city and over Your people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 0_Paragra: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Benjamin ben Zorach.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 1_Paragra: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 3_Paragra: to entreat You with our lips;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 9_Paragra: that come from time to time.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 11_Paragr: with broken spirit and humbled heart,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 13_Paragr: all our follies and stubborness of heart;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 15_Paragr: and heals the broken in spirit,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 16_Paragr: renew a correct spirit within us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 17_Paragr: and create for us a pure heart.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 25_Paragr: in times of anguish and distress.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 31_Paragr: there is no hope for his iniquity.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 32_Paragr: Even if he prepares and offers
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 33_Paragr: all the rams of Nevayos1A place of the choicest rams. to help him,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 34_Paragr: though he will plead and cry
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 35_Paragr: his prayer will not be heard.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 37_Paragr: as well as those of the individual,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 39_Paragr: for You, our Rock, hear prayer;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 43_Paragr: as though we had brought burnt-offerings.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 47_Paragr: whom You took for Your treasure—
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 49_Paragr: be drowned in the depths of the sea,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 50_Paragr: and let them praise You forever
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 53_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 55_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 56_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 60_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 67_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 69_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 80_Paragr: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 85_Paragr: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 86_Paragr: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 87_Paragr: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 88_Paragr: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 89_Paragr: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 93_Paragr: to all who call upon You.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 94_Paragr: Remember not the sins of our ancestors,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 95_Paragr: let Your mercy come swiftly toward us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 96_Paragr: for we have been brought very low.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 97_Paragr: For Adonoy hears the [cry] of the needy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 98_Paragr: and His bound ones, He does not shame.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 99_Paragr: For our lives are spent in sorrow,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 101_Parag: For because of [our faith in] You
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 105_Parag: For You will not forsake us forever, O God.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 106_Parag: As a father has compassion on his children
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 107_Parag: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 109_Parag: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 111_Parag: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 5_Chapter, 119_Parag: and as You forgave this people

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 0_Paragra: This prayer was composed by Rav Shimon ben Isaac [R’ Shimon the Great].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 1_Paragra: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 2_Paragra: Send us Your light and Your truth,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 3_Paragra: grant good fortune to those who believe in You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 4_Paragra: for You Adonoy are good and forgiving.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 6_Paragra: in Your goodness, take us to freedom,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 7_Paragra: for the waters have reached our souls.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 9_Paragra: return our exiles to their dwellings,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 10_Paragr: for we are strangers and sojourners.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 11_Paragr: We knock at Your door constantly,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 12_Paragr: we cling to You, to be joined,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 13_Paragr: for we have been brought very low.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 14_Paragr: The insolent deride us in our plight,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 15_Paragr: save us that we may thank You, our Rock,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 18_Paragr: Your dispersed ones look to You for support,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 19_Paragr: strengthen them in their fear of You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 20_Paragr: for this is the whole purpose of man.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 21_Paragr: The laws of the heathen peoples are vanity,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 22_Paragr: but Your desired ones follow You longingly
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 23_Paragr: for You are gracious and merciful.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 24_Paragr: Your Temple was turned into ruins,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 26_Paragr: for Your kindness1In returning Your Shechinah to dwell among us. is better than life.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 27_Paragr: I am weary and in my affliction I pray:
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 28_Paragr: “May my oppressor be shamed and disgraced,”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 29_Paragr: for Adonoy will do justice for the afflicted.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 30_Paragr: The speech of my enemies lie heavy on me,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 31_Paragr: they provoke me all the day,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 32_Paragr: and thus my days are consumed in smoke.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 33_Paragr: May He pay them according to their deeds,2Israel’s.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 34_Paragr: and thus teach His people a beneficial lesson,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 35_Paragr: that He will not cast us off forever.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 36_Paragr: May his Merciful One grant his desire,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 37_Paragr: and remove his disgrace from him,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 38_Paragr: for how good and how beautiful was he.3When he [Israel] lived on its own land.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 41_Paragr: because I bore the disgrace4The sins. of my youth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 42_Paragr: “I will yet greatly rejoice in you,”5Isaiah 61:10.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 43_Paragr: when You will say this to Your redeemed,6Israel.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 44_Paragr: [they will say:] “For You have given me joy, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 46_Paragr: Mighty One! Awesome One! Revered One!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 51_Paragr: that we may proclaim Your glorious praise—
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 53_Paragr: May our enemies perish by excisement,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 54_Paragr: look down on us from the mighty heavens,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 55_Paragr: for our days on earth are a shadow.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 56_Paragr: Bring near the time of my redemption,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 58_Paragr: “That the day of Adonoy is near.”7Joel 1:15.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 60_Paragr: to Your beloved,8Israel. show a pleasant countenance,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 62_Paragr: He still regards the lowly.9psalms 138:6.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 63_Paragr: Hear the voice of my supplication,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 64_Paragr: let my prayer ascend to Your dwelling,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 65_Paragr: for Adonoy hears the cry of the needy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 66_Paragr: Favor our prayer as a thanksgiving offering,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 69_Paragr: for the Torah shall go forth from Me.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 70_Paragr: He will incline the scale [in our favor],
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 71_Paragr: He will garb and wrap Himself in strength,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 72_Paragr: for He causes pain and brings healing.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 74_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 76_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 77_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 81_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 88_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 90_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 101_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 106_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 107_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 108_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 109_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 110_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 114_Parag: to all who call upon You.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 117_Parag: and cast into the depths of the sea
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 120_Parag: and let Your mind be changed
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 121_Parag: concerning the evil intended for Your people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 124_Parag: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 126_Parag: renew our days as of old.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 127_Parag: As a father has compassion on his children
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 128_Parag: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 130_Parag: upon Your people is Your blessing. Selah!
