text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 132_Parag: a stronghold for us is the God of Jacob. Selah!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 134_Parag: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 136_Parag: the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 137_Parag: “Please pardon the sins of this nation
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 140_Parag: and as You forgave this people
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 141_Parag: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 144_Parag: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 145_Parag: Incline Your ear, my God, and hear,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 146_Parag: open Your eyes and behold our desolate places,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 147_Parag: and the city which is called by Your Name;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 148_Parag: for it is not on account of our righteousness
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 6_Chapter, 149_Parag: that we let fall our supplication before You,

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 0_Paragra: This prayer was composed by Rav Shlomo Habavli.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 1_Paragra: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 3_Paragra: bring back our exiles as You promised,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 9_Paragra: and let Your mind be changed
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 10_Paragr: concerning the evil intended for Your people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 11_Paragr: Gather and seek the lost ones,1Israel.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 12_Paragr: and strengthen Your inheritance—2Israel.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 15_Paragr: If the transgressions are too numerous
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 16_Paragr: among those who crave Your forgiveness,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 17_Paragr: turn [from Your anger] for the sake of
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 18_Paragr: Your servants, the tribes of Your heritage.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 21_Paragr: and we have to taste the sour grapes;3See Jeremiah 31:29. I.e. the punishment of their sins.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 22_Paragr: we were made to drink the cup of poison,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 24_Paragr: As in the days when You dwelt among us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 26_Paragr: return to us, O God of our deliverance,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 27_Paragr: and annul Your anger toward us.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 29_Paragr: those who take refuge in You
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 31_Paragr: they have been punished for their sins,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 32_Paragr: and look to You to be healed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 35_Paragr: Turn [from Your anger] Adonoy, how long?
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 36_Paragr: and change Your mind about Your servants.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 38_Paragr: for the revelation of Your secret4The coming of Moshiach.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 40_Paragr: [while] Your pious ones waste away [in exile];
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 42_Paragr: as we wait for Your graciousness.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 44_Paragr: deliver us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 47_Paragr: that go down into the grave,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 55_Paragr: of those who trust in You,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 59_Paragr: As You appeared then in a vision,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 60_Paragr: as You spoke to the righteous [prophets]—
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 62_Paragr: to the thousand myriads of Israel.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 67_Paragr: Even though our sins are numerous,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 70_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 73_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 75_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 76_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 80_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 87_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 89_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 100_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 105_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 106_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 107_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 108_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 109_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 113_Parag: to all who call upon You.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 115_Parag: and deliver us for the sake of Your kindliness.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 116_Parag: Return, return, You have said to us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 118_Parag: from the very beginning of creation
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 125_Parag: the groaning of the prisoner [of sin],
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 126_Parag: according to the greatness of Your power
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 127_Parag: set free those condemned to die.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 130_Parag: as You have sworn to our fathers
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 132_Parag: As a father has compassion on his children
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 133_Parag: so do You have compassion on us, Adonoy.

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 139_Parag: fortunate is the man who trusts in You.

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 145_Parag: and as You forgave this people
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 146_Parag: from when it left Egypt until now.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 7_Chapter, 149_Parag: I have pardoned [them] as you have asked.”

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 0_Paragra: This prayer was composed by Rav Ephraim ben Isaac of Regensburg. It is entitled the Akeidah, the Binding and retells the episode of the binding of Isaac.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 1_Paragra: Our God and God of our fathers!
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 2_Paragra: Though the pigeon offerings have ceased,1The literal translation of the word רֶבַע is a quarter. In the time of the Temple a poor man was permitted to bring doves or young pigeons which were worth a quarter of a dinar for his offerings.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 3_Paragra: though the tent of His dwelling is now empty,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 5_Paragra: for we have the merit of our old father.2Abraham.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 7_Paragra: when we mention his righteousness before You;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 10_Paragr: and let his blood be wrung out
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 12_Paragr: He ran to the lad and consecrated him,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 13_Paragr: though his soul was bound up in his soul;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 14_Paragr: he put the wood and fire around him,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 15_Paragr: and the crown of his God was on his head.3Abraham was compared to the Kohain Gadol who wore the Crown of God upon his forehead.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 16_Paragr: The only son, tender and light as a deer,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 17_Paragr: answered and said to his father,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 18_Paragr: “Behold we are bringing the fire and wood,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 19_Paragr: but there is no offering to bring.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 24_Paragr: and Adonoy will let us know
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 27_Paragr: and did not question You[r word];
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 30_Paragr: When they saw a blazing pillar of fire,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 31_Paragr: they quickly brought the wood for
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 34_Paragr: they walked straight through the wilderness
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 35_Paragr: as though it was a plain.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 37_Paragr: that he was to be the lamb,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 38_Paragr: he said to his father, the tested one4God had tested Abraham with nine tests and this was the tenth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 39_Paragr: “Do with me as you would a lamb,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 40_Paragr: have no pity and do not spare me.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 41_Paragr: He [God] has delight in me and desires me,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 42_Paragr: to Him I will bare my heart;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 43_Paragr: even should you refuse to sacrifice me,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 44_Paragr: in the end my spirit and my soul
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 46_Paragr: He [Abraham] bowed his hands and feet,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 47_Paragr: and held his sword over him;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 48_Paragr: he laid him carefully on the wood
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 49_Paragr: as the fire blazed on the altar.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 50_Paragr: He stretched forth his neck willingly,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 52_Paragr: to slaughter him in the Name of his Master
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 53_Paragr: and behold, Adonoy stood over him.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 54_Paragr: God observed what was being done,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 55_Paragr: how the father had not spared his son,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 56_Paragr: his heart and his hands were lifted [as one],5To do God’s will.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 60_Paragr: who was sanctified from the womb,6See Rashi, Psalms 110:3.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 61_Paragr: choose an exchange for your son,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 64_Paragr: The exchanged [ram] will be his offering,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 67_Paragr: and it will be [as if] he
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 68_Paragr: and his exchange [are offered before Me].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 69_Paragr: May the memory be before You in heaven,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 74_Paragr: Your worshippers have come to bow to You;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 75_Paragr: regard the righteousness of that binding
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 76_Paragr: and remember Your flock with compassion,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 78_Paragr: look to the merit of the binding.7Israel hopes that it will be redeemed in the merit of the Akeidah [binding].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 80_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 82_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 83_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 87_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 94_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 96_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 107_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 8_Chapter, 112_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.”

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 0_Paragra: This prayer was composed by Rabbi Benjamin ben Zorach.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 1_Paragra: You taught the way of repentance
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 3_Paragra: between Rosh Hashana and Yom Kippur
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 4_Paragra: we are to return unto You [in repentance].
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 5_Paragra: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 8_Paragra: You prepared the way for repentance,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 9_Paragra: before You spread out the mighty heavens,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 12_Paragr: repentance is a balm and a remedy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 13_Paragr: Those who knock at Your door,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 14_Paragr: do not send them away empty-handed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 15_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 17_Paragr: Behold, the first to be created from dust,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 18_Paragr: Adam, the first to be formed,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 19_Paragr: You tried him with a light commandment,1Not to eat from the tree of knowledge.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 21_Paragr: You were indignant and angry with him,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 24_Paragr: You preserved him like the apple of Your eye.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 25_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 29_Paragr: You sentenced him to be a wanderer,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 30_Paragr: to go from place to place;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 31_Paragr: but when he returned to You
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 33_Paragr: You prolonged his life to seven generations,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 36_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 38_Paragr: He [Reuben] who profaned his father’s bed,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 40_Paragr: his feet had almost slipped2He was almost condemned to Gehinom for his sin.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 41_Paragr: had he not poured out his heart as water.3Before You in repentance.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 43_Paragr: with Tamar at Enaim,4See Genesis 38:15–23.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 45_Paragr: You inclined the scale to justify him.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 46_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 48_Paragr: He broke the barriers of the world,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 49_Paragr: did [Achav] son of Omri, with his wickedness,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 50_Paragr: he desired to worship the Asherim idols,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 51_Paragr: and added transgression upon sin.5By causing others to do likewise.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 53_Paragr: when he repented of his transgressions;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 54_Paragr: You had mercy on him as he confessed
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 56_Paragr: and in You he found deliverance.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 57_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 60_Paragr: had the people of [Ninveh] the great city,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 63_Paragr: when You sent the vision of their destruction6Through the prophet Jonah.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 64_Paragr: they were seized with trembling and terror;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 66_Paragr: it was accepted before Your glorious throne.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 67_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 69_Paragr: You Who searches the innermost heart,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 70_Paragr: and Who is girded with might,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 71_Paragr: teach us that we may know
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 75_Paragr: for Your sake, please, cause us to return,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 76_Paragr: that we should repent in the proper way.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 77_Paragr: Cause us to return to You, Adonoy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 80_Paragr: Who sits on the throne of mercy,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 82_Paragr: forgives the iniquities of His people.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 83_Paragr: He removes their sins one by one,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 87_Paragr: with all who are of flesh and spirit;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 94_Paragr: the covenant of thirteen Divine attributes,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 96_Paragr: to the humble Moses of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 107_Parag: and Abundant in Kindness, and Truth.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 112_Parag: and Acquitter of those who repent.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 113_Parag: “And pardon our iniquity and our sin,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 114_Parag: and take us for Your inheritance.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 115_Parag: Pardon us our Father, for we have sinned,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 116_Parag: forgive us our King, for we have transgressed.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 120_Parag: to all who call upon You.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 121_Parag: Remember not the sins of our ancestors;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 122_Parag: let Your compassion come swiftly toward us,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 123_Parag: for we have been brought very low.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 124_Parag: The sins of our youth and our transgressions,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 127_Parag: for the sake of Your goodness, Adonoy.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 130_Parag: for they are from the beginning of the world.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 135_Parag: which You have acquired of old,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 138_Parag: this mountain of Zion where You have dwelled.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 139_Parag: Remember, Adonoy, the affection of Jerusalem,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 140_Parag: the love of Zion, forget not until eternity.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 142_Parag: to the sons of Edom, the day of Jerusalem,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 144_Parag: “Raze it, raze it to its very foundations.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 147_Parag: for it is time to be gracious to her,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 148_Parag: for the appointed time has come.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 151_Parag: to whom You swore by Your very Self,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 154_Parag: as the stars of the heavens;
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 155_Parag: and all this land that I have promised,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 156_Parag: I will give to your descendants,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 157_Parag: and they will inherit it forever.”
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 160_Parag: do not regard the stubborness of this people,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 161_Parag: or their wickedness, or their sin.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 9_Chapter, 164_Parag: wherein we have acted foolishly and sinned.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 0_Paragr: This prayer is based on the Midrash of the ten martyrs who were killed by the Romans. It was written by Rav Yoel ben Yitzchok HaLevi.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 1_Paragr: Your “friends”1“Friends,” the righteous are considered God’s “friends.” are dear,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 3_Paragr: I shall wait for God and hope [for His help]
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 4_Paragr: [that You take vengeance] from the enemy
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 8_Paragr: and let him don sackcloths2As a sign of suffering.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 10_Parag: of those who are tied in chains.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 11_Parag: As of now Your servants are still smitten.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 12_Parag: “These are flogged.”2*“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the בֵּית דִין—the Jewish court.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 13_Parag: We have sinned to You, our Rock,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 15_Parag: They smite and strike with whips
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 16_Parag: [the people known as] My one nation.3I.e. Israel.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 17_Parag: My drink was blended with tears.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 18_Parag: From the deepest pits I called Your Name:
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 19_Parag: Where [and when will I find] my hope?
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 21_Parag: [But within our] homes there is fear.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 22_Parag: I did not hide from disgrace.4For I was accustomed to it.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 24_Parag: is slaughtered upon the hills and mountains.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 25_Parag: “These are the sin-offerings.”2*“These are flogged.” Each verse ends with a punishment meted out by the בֵּית דִין—the Jewish court.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 26_Parag: We have sinned to You, our Rock,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 29_Parag: and they [therefore] torture Your inheritance.5I.e. Israel is tortured by the nations.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 30_Parag: And we are considered as sheep for slaughter.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 31_Parag: The best of us are trapped for our sins.6I.e. the righteous are punished for the sins of the rest.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 33_Parag: for [that which happens to] our brothers.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 35_Parag: all their blood is spilled as waste,

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 39_Parag: We have sinned to You, our Rock,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 41_Parag: Your young are stoned before Your eyes
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 42_Parag: on [sanctifying Your Name7“Sanctify Your name’—קִדוּשׁ הַשֵׁם—the act of giving one’s life for God. by] death,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 43_Parag: and the enemy has prepared for him
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 46_Parag: the bitterness of death has reached you.”8I.e. your end has come.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 48_Parag: but, He turned it to darkness of death.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 49_Parag: In the place of deep darkness,
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 50_Parag: their voice [still] chirps.9‘In … chirps,” i.e. despite great despair we don’t cease to pray.

text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 52_Parag: my limbs tremble and turn weak.
text.8_Fast of Gedaliah, 10_Chapter, 54_Parag: and were found to be purified.
